boardgame.name: Light Gray & the Abundant Tactics of the Fifth Era
Light Gray and the Abundant Tactics of the Fifth Era
boardgame.description:
LG TACTICS is a strategy-lite battle card game where you must outmaneuver your opponents to win. It features simple gameplay where you decide which cards to deploy and attack with.

The game is played with a single deck of cards and you can learn the rules in minutes. Players need to Recruit, Deploy and Attack with their cards until only one army remains. You can play against one or more opponent, or even play solo to test your skills. Games take about 15 minutes per person, and 1 - 5 people can play (more if you combine 2 decks).

Game cards feature a single number representing its power level. Some powerful cards have a deploy requirement in order to play onto the battlefield.

TACTICS comes with 72 cards and rule book in a game box. Cards feature original illustrations in a minimal fantasy silhouette style.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Beyond the Rift: A Perdition's Mouth Card Game
boardgame.description:
Beyond the Rift: A Perdition’s Mouth Card Game is a cooperative card game for 1-4 players, narrating the events taking place after the heroes overcame Perdition's Mouth: Abyssal Rift.

A foul stench was in the air, as the last guests stumbled upstairs, some still shaking their heads at what they had just heard.

"Fools," Niffil cursed, as another attempt to warn them of the danger of the 'Cult of Progress' had failed.

"These peasants wouldn’t believe it even if a demon ate their cattle," Elisa added. Wobbling over, Bastian noticed that the innkeeper did not only carry a tankard, but also a letter.

"This came for you, Bastian." he mumbled. "I think it’s from somewhere in the East," he added, slamming the tankard on the table.

The vax seal told Bastian who it was from, and a gnawing feeling in his gut told him what it was about. He didn’t want to get involved but felt he had no choice.


Dare to explore the land of Zanziar, via branching paths of six campaigns, each focusing on one of the six Heroes within the game. Become a stoic warrior, take on the role of a spunky magus, relive the life of a dwarven tinkerer, enact the pious ways of a zealous halfling priest, duck below any bar like a proper rogue, or embrace the inner rage of a Berserker.

Each hero has two basic resources at their disposal, Action Points and their Hero Deck.
Drawing from their hero deck players will find a variety of action cards that will determine what actions heroes are able to perform. Playing a card will cost action points which can also be used to draw more cards, manipulate the position of enemies and activate special abilities. Managing one's resources of cards and action points, while dealing with the many threats presented will be key to survival in Beyond the Rift.

Utilizing the Evolving Deck System, heroes acquire items that replace cards from their original starting deck, making them decks of ever-growing power and synergy, as the campaign progresses.

By navigating their way through the six campaigns, players will not only discover the wondrous world of Zanziar, but will also gain knowledge about the sinister, dark past of its inhabitants and that of the heroes themselves.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Vindication: Wintertide Promo Pack
boardgame.description:
"Contains 15 bone-chilling cards for Vindication Board Game to warm your frozen heart. That's cold. We know."

15 all-new promotional cards not included in any version of Vindication. Includes an all-new “Equippable Relic” card, which attaches to a companion.

Cards include:
3 Companion Cards
1 Lost Pet Spirit Card
1 Cursed Pet Spirit Card
3 Trait Cards
1 Relic Card + 1 Equippable Relic Card
4 Monster Cards
1 Loot Card
Excess Shivery Vibes

listing.notes:
NEW!
+Shipping
PayPal and Venmo payment preferred.

boardgame.name: Reindeer Games
boardgame.description:
Rudolph is on vacation, and the other deer are back playing their reindeer games to choose who will guide Santa's sleigh...

Reindeer Games is a fully digital board game that people can play together at home and include others remotely over Zoom at the same time.

In the style of a good family board game, everyone talks and negotiates before taking their actions and the game is about considered actions, not the manipulation of graphics — but the game play is all entered on phones, and the "game board" is any laptop, tablet or TV with a browser that everyone can see together.

Reindeer Games is simple enough that everyone can play, interactive as you need to coordinate with other players to win, strategic in choosing how and when to act — all set in a beautiful animated world.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Na Babią Górę
boardgame.description: In the game, players will climb the Babia Góra, observing nature. Taking cards from the common pot allows you to build another level of the mountain and the pawn shows the place of our climbing. The card can be used in three ways: as a part of the mountain, as an element of nature or as an equipment. In order to enter the next cards it is necessary to have the appropriate equipment. Players earn points for the cards they have visited and sets of nature cards (animals, plants). The player with the most points wins.

boardgame.name: Magi: Alma Torran
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

The story of Magi began not when the young Magi Aladdin and prince Alibaba met for the first time or even when Sinbad ventured across the Seven Seas, but many centuries before that, on a world in an entirely different space. This place was known as Alma Torran, a world populated not just by humans, but by all manner of species, from the indomitable red lions to the monstrous ogres, who waged constant war amongst each other.

boardgame.name: The Neverending Story
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Bastian Balthasar Bux is being bullied at school. His escape from reality: books. Through a mysterious book he learns of the land Fantasia that is threatened by a mysterious power. In the story, the young hero Atreyu sets out on a journey to save the childlike empress and all of Fantasia. He experiences wondrous adventures aided by the luck dragon Fuchur and gets to know many mythical creatures. But Fantasia seems to be lost, despite Atrejus efforts, until Bastian realizes what role he has to play in the Neverending Story.

boardgame.name: Arifureta: From Commonplace to World's Strongest
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Welcome to Tortus, jumper! A world of magic, monster, gods and more. Right now, this world is ruled by 3 major races. The humans reside and rule the northern half of the continent, while the demons reside and rule the southern half. The beastmen reside in the far east in a massive forest known as the Sea of Trees. These races are at war, with both humans and demons being able to cast magic and considering that as a gift from their respective Gods. While Demons are stronger individually, Humanity has the advantage of numbers. Meanwhile demihumans don’t possess magic and are constantly enslaved outside their country. Lately, the balance has been broken as Demons have become capable of controlling magical beasts, rendering humanity’s advantage useless.

boardgame.name: Fantasy Fluxx
boardgame.description:
Fluxx is a card game in which the cards themselves determine the current rules of the game. By playing cards, you change numerous aspects of the game: how to draw cards, how to play cards, and even how to win.

At the start of the game, each player holds three cards and on a turn a player draws one card, then plays one card. By playing cards, you can put new rules into play that change numerous aspects of the game: how many cards to draw or play, how many cards you can hold in hand or keep on the table in front of you, and (most importantly) how to win the game.

In Fantasy Fluxx, you want to gather your friends for a party — an adventuring party, that is! Pack up your Second Breakfasts, and set off on a classic quest with your faithful companions: the Helpful Elf, the Dwarven Warrior, the Gallant Swordsman, the Wise Old Wizard, and of course, the Humble Young Hero! Learn from the Cranky Magic Teacher how to use your Wand to cast spells like Invisibility or Fireball! You may need them as you encounter the Dreaded Pirate, or when you find out that Captured Princess is actually the Mother of Dragons! Will you and your fantasy favorites survive the Final Showdown with the Dark Lord?

Onward Retainer An adventuring comic in the old school style, starring The Legion

boardgame.rpg: Dungeon Crawl Classics Role Playing Game

boardgame.name: Southeast Asia Sourcebook
boardgame.description:
Foreward:

This sourcebook was originally to be printed by the late lamented Chameleon Eclectic Entertainment in 1997. I proposed the sourcebook to Charles Ryan and he commissioned a 70,000 word book. The work took longer than I intended and before I could finish it, CEE became insolvent. I finished up some of it and put it aside, sorry for the loss. I discovered millenniumsend.com in 2001 and resurrected the work, but shortly afterward had a hard drive meltdown that I believed had claimed the files. It
wasn’t until 2003, when cleaning up a variety of computer-related junk, did I find that I had backed up an earlier incarnation of the files onto disk. They are yours now.

The Southeast Asia Sourcebook is taken from my personal experience living in Thailand working with Cambodian refugees, melded with the world setting of Millennium’s End. I hoped to present a holistic, all encompassing feeling that gave an experience as thick as Bangkok’s summer heat. Also, I wanted to provide a launching point for players in the great city of Sydney.

A note to the graphics: none were created for the book, but I used maps that were readily available from the Web and various atlases when writing and I believe that most players will be able to discover the real-world locations listed.

boardgame.name: ONE
boardgame.description:
ONE is a simple strategy game for 2-6 players.

Your goal is to form the largest group of connected stones. Capture opponents' stones to block their expansion and add points to your score. At the end of the game, the player with the most points wins.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Boldog kicsi dinók
Dinokalipsa
Happy Little Dinosaurs
boardgame.description:
Lately, it feels like we’re all just dinosaurs trying to avoid the falling meteors. In this game, you’ll try to dodge all of life’s little disasters. You might fall into a pit of hot lava or get ghosted by your dino date, but the dino who survives it all wins the game!

In Happy Little Dinosaurs, the first person to reach 50 points, or be the last Dinosaur standing, wins the game! During each round, you’ll flip a Disaster card featuring a Natural, Predatory, or Emotional disaster. Each player will play a Point card in hopes of collecting points and avoiding the disaster.

You will work to avoid all of life’s little disasters and laugh as they happen to your friends. If you collect 3 Disaster cards of the same type OR 3 different types of Disaster cards, you will be out of the game. Point cards feature weapons, trinkets, and good luck charms that you use to collect points and avoid disasters. Each card has a point value between 0 and 9 that you will use when scoring a round. You can use Instant cards at different points during the game to tip the odds in your favor or save your Dinosaur from certain death.

Player boards include your Dinosaur's traits, an Escape Route you use to track your score, and a Disaster Area where you will collect Disaster cards. You'll move your Dinosaur meeple along the Excape Route on your player board to track your score. Will you successfully dodge the disasters or get eaten by a prehistoric whale? Only the cards can decide.
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Happy Little Dinosaurs: 5-6 Player Expansion Pack
Happy Little Dinosaurs: Perils of Puberty

boardgame.name: Lawklivya: Vengeance
boardgame.description:
In the land of Lawklivya, there was a time when a large community lived and prospered together. However, as people started to disappear, they began to gather in castles and become more independent, fearful, and competitive. They believed they could exist separately from each other. They will soon learn they are stronger together, and their cooperation will be essential to beat this evil once and for all

The goal of Lawklivya: Vengeance is to survive the ongoing assault of your castles by different enemies. This is accomplished through gathering resources, using those resources to create weapons, upgrade walls, and train workers into warriors, scouts, and a warrior hero! When an enemy attacks your castle, the other castles can send warriors to assist in the battle. When the castles have defeated a certain number of enemies, they must confront the biggest and most powerful enemy. This victory will come at a cost, and will only be accomplished with all of the castle's warriors working together!

-description from publisher

listing.notes:
This is a brandnew, sealed copy. Latest edition. Fresh from Kickstarter. USA shipping please ask for a quote to your zip. Can combine shipping for multiple games.
5 lbs 12x12x4 inch

boardgame.name: Beisbol Montecarlo
boardgame.description:
There are two teams, with 10 tokens each: a pitcher, a catcher, a hitter and 7 generic.

Before start a game, the cards are mixed and a half goes to the big pairs space and the other half to the small pairs space, with the text face down.

Each player take and rolls a dice; the bigger number goes to pitch and the lower to the bat. The tokens are placed accordingly in the field. The player with the hitter then rolls both dices, the resulting number indicates the play: a strike, a ball, foul or steal the base. The base also can be stolen between plays. When the dices shows a pair, it's time to take a card and follow their instructions.

—user summary

boardgame.name: Whac-a-Mole Stack-a-mole
boardgame.description:
Inspired by the kid favorite Whac-A-Mole game, Stack-A-Mole is the fun way to teach little ones about colors, matching and sequencing. Your mission is to use your mallet to stack up the mole cups in a certain sequence. But hurry- your opponent is trying to stack them first. Be the first to stack all the cups in the correct order and you win! It's mallet-smacking, mole-stackin' and learning fun!

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Umurangi Generation
boardgame.description:
Umurangi Generation is a first person photography game in the shitty future. Set in Tauranga Aotearoa off the back of an impending crisis you are a courier for the Tauranga Express. Throughout the game you will unlock a variety of lenses and equipment.

Source: The Game Website.
boardgame.videogamehonor: 2021 Pav Awards The Composed Segment Winner
2021 Pav Awards The Decorative Piece Winner
2021 Pav Awards The ‘Slice of Heaven’ Grand Prize Winner
2021 Game Developers Choice Awards Best New IP of the Year Nominee
2021 Game Developers Choice Awards Best Visual Arts of the Year Nominee

boardgame.name: TOKOYO: The Tower of Perpetuity
boardgame.description:
Carve your legend onto a tower that changes form every day.

You have wandered into a tower that changes its layout every 24 hours…
Your legend will remain as a gravestone to serve as a reminder for those who challenge the tower after you. Keep climbing past the gravestones of the ones that came before you and aim for the top.

TOKOYO: The Tower of Perpetuity is a 2D social rogue-like game set in the titular Tower of Perpetuity, filled with savage monsters and traps, which is procedurally generated every 24 hours. The title has been created by solo indie developer Saebashi under his personal doujin circle //commentout.

In sharp contrast to the overall cute character and game design, the gameplay is tough, with challenging boss fights and platforming sequences to put your skills to the test.

FEATURES
A procedurally generated dungeon that changes everyday
TOKOYO: The Tower of Perpetuity features a tower which is procedurally generated every 24 hours in real time. This causes the layout to change along with enemy and trap placements. Players will have 24 hours to challenge that version of the tower and compete with other players around the world for a shot at the top rank.
As the tower layout will be completely different the next day, there will be no memorizing the layout or a set way to climb the tower. This leads to great replayability and indeed some players may find this aspect addictive. The tower also has split routes to choose from which adds to the random challenge of the game.

Light social elements
The game features light social elements whereby when you game-over a gravestone will be erected where you fell. Along with your gravestone you will be able to select some final words and an item of yours will be left behind to appear in other players’ game instances. Climb higher past your fallen rivals and use the character specific skills to your advantage to overcome the challenges of the impregnable tower.

Character customization
Players can edit character skins and skill cut-ins easily, you can even implement your own phrases as subtitles. Aim for the top playing as your very own unique character. We are also looking for Illustrators, streamers and companies that hold existing IPs who are willing to let their original characters appear in TOKOYO as an official collab character too!

Source: The Publisher Website.

boardgame.name: ICBM
boardgame.description:
User Summary

ICBM is a real-time strategy game centered on the nuclear arms race. Players must manage their resources, research cutting edge technologies, and maintain a stockpile of nuclear weapons in order to strike against their opponents. Taking control of one of the real-world continents, players will prepare themselves and their citizens for nuclear war. The ultimate goal of the game is to annihilate opponents while protecting one's own citizens.

The game presents players with a flexible set of options for how to progress in the game. The various technologies in the game span old and new, and players may choose to focus their efforts on existing technologies in order to increase their arsenal faster, or they can opt for cutting edge technologies that will lead to more powerful weapons. Furthermore, ICBM puts players in control of a variety of aircraft and missile delivery systems, allowing them to choose bombarding opponents from afar with ICMBs or using a fleet of bombers to drop large nuclear payloads on their opponents. The game also boasts 20 unique unit types that players can control along with 12 types of nuclear weapons, and over 40 technologies to research and implement.

In addition to the destruction and mass proliferation of nuclear weapons, ICBM additionally encourages the use of diplomacy in order to gain a strategic advantage. Players can forge alliances in order to share information, gain access to technologies, or share in their nuclear weapons stockpile. These alliances may be temporary or lasting depending on how the player sees fit. Players can cooperatively develop long term strategies and short term tactics in order to win. The game features a "strike planner" that players can use to automate control of units and implement their plans over time. However, ICBM does allow players to micromanage their units and resources to their heart's content.

The game also features an online PvP and cooperative mode for up to 8 players. Matches can be free-for-all or teams of 4v4. There is also a fully cooperative mode where each player works towards a common goal. Expandability and customization are an important element of the game as well. ICBM comes with full mod support out of the box, allowing players to add or change maps, create additional units and technologies, custom graphics, and even implement custom rule sets.

boardgame.name: Nibble
boardgame.description:
Nibble is a strategy game for two players by Jared McComb, inspired by the works of Dieter Stein (SEVN) and Reiner Knizia. In Nibble, two players take turns taking pieces of nine colors trying to claim majorities in those colors, but can also win the game instantly in two different ways.

COMPONENTS


81 discs in 9 colours (9 each)
Board


RULES OVERVIEW (Please refer to rulebook)

Randomly place the 81 discs on the board such that no two of the same color are orthogonally adjacent (diagonally adjacent is OK).

Players alternate turns taking discs from the board according to the following rules:

1) Discs may only be taken if they have at least two adjacent exposed sides.

2) A player must always take at least one disc on their turn (that is, players may not pass) and may take as many additional discs as they like on a turn, as long as all of those discs are the same color as the first one. They are not required to take all of the available discs of that color and may opt to leave one or more behind.

3) A disc may not be taken if it would divide the remaining discs into two separate groups (counting orthogonal connections only).

When a player takes discs, they should place them in a row on the table behind the correspondingly colored triangle on the board.

If a player takes their 5th, 7th, or 9th disc of a color, they should place it on the corresponding circle on their side of the board to make it clear how close they are to reaching one of the three win conditions.

WINNING THE GAME

A player wins the game immediately if they achieve either of the following:


Collect all 9 discs of one color
Collect at least 7 discs each of three adjacent colors in a row.


If neither player is able to accomplish either of these, continue play until all the discs have been taken. The winner is the player with the majority of majorities (5 or more discs in each of 5 or more colors).

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Furl
boardgame.description:
Either furl up a row of your discs, or unfurl a stack. If you have a disc in your end row at the start of your turn, you win.

COMPONENTS:

Hexagonal board with 4 hexes per side
15 white discs
15 black discs


RULES OVERVIEW (Please refer to rulebook)

Players alternate turns until the victory condition is reached.

Each turn, choose one of two types of moves:

Furl

Choose two or more of your discs in an unbroken line, and stack them on the disc at the end of that line.

Unfurl

Choose a stack of at least two discs and sow them one per space in a straight line starting in the space in front of your stack. Intermediate spaces must be empty, but the final space may be occupied by an enemy disc or enemy stack. If so, you capture those discs.

GOAL

You win if, at the start of your turn, you have a disc or stack on the row farthest from your starting position.

You lose if you have no legal moves.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Hippos & Crocodiles: Marabou
boardgame.description:
Marabou Stork is an expansion of Hippos & Crocodiles that contains 12 bird pieces.

You can use this animal to play games from 2 to 4 players. For 4 players I recommend playing in pairs with the members of each pair facing each other, so the turns alternate between pairs:

Team A: Anna
Team B: Bob
Team A: Carl
Team B; Diana
… and so on.

The couple that places the last animal wins.

The Marabou Stork has an exception to placement: Once per game, the player can place one and only one of her tiles with the beak or feet outside the board.

boardgame.name: De S.P.E.L.Show: Het bordspel
boardgame.description:
Play the wildly popular S.P.E.L.show at home now!
Challenge your friends or family to a strategic language battle and show how good your knowledge of the Dutch language is. For example, what is a "barki"? What is the past tense of "gliding"? And which word means both an "end" and a "castle"?
The two players with the most points after five rounds advance to the final round. Are you the best player in the final? Then you win the game!

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Neighborhood Conflict
boardgame.description:
Neighborhood Conflict is based on the creator's childhood where the local kids formed their own governments and economies. Construction, share trading, real estate, currency manipulation, diplomacy, theft and combat are all optional strategic tools for getting ahead in Neighborhood Conflict.

Players play as a kid and interact with other kids that have different social and economic skills, and try to manipulate them into assisting their own ascension to the top. Kids use "actions" to either attempt to socially alter the opinions and behavior of other kids or to manage and improve their own financial situation. The goal of the game is to acquire as much wealth as possible before time is up.

—description from the designer

Neighborhood Conflict was modeled after the LARPG City.

NOTE:

Not to be confused with first edition of Neighborhood Conflict, which was also named Neighborhood Conflict, but got renamed to Tactical Friction in 2008.
Not to be confused with first edition of Micronations, which was also named Neighborhood Conflict in years 2011–2013.

boardgame.name: Aristeia!: Prime Time
boardgame.description:
Prime Time is a new Aristeia! expansion that allows up to 4 players to play in the HexaDome. The fun is multiplied, while the rules and some game elements have been adapted to keep the same rhythm, feeling, and match duration of Aristeia!. The booklet includes 4 new scenarios that are exclusive to this multiplayer mode, some of which will eventually be adapted to the standard game mode.

Being an experienced player is not necessary at all. Prime Time’s booklet includes an introduction which will allow rookie players to easily learn the ropes of Aristeia!, step by step, with the appropriate modifications added for 3 or 4 players. Two specific short-duration scenarios are also added to help players learn the basic concepts and mechanics of Aristeia!. Veteran players will find a section with all of Prime Time’s new rules, so they will not need to go through the tutorial.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Locked Adventures: Der Fall – Berlin
boardgame.description: Your team accepted the invitation of a renowned journalism school to Berlin, where a student turned to you for help: Her friend Christopher suddenly went into hiding because he had got wind of a suspicious matter. Christopher was in the utmost panic and said that it was a matter of life and death, but the police must not be called on under any circumstances! Your investigative talent is more in demand than ever in the new city. You make your way through unknown Berlin to help Christopher. Are you late or can you still provide last-minute help?

boardgame.name: Citytrip Paris
boardgame.description:
Citytrip Paris is the third game in the 'Citytrip series' featuring new gameplay elements.

As a tour guide you want to create the most memorable trip by visiting famous buildings and musea, events, restaurants and more.

Citytrip Paris is a flip & write game that is quick to setup and easy to play. With a basic and advanced scoresheet, 23 starting points and 44 different missions, no 2 games will feel the same!

One player flips the upper card of the action stack. Simultaneously everybody chooses 2 actions that are horizontally or vertically adjacent (=7 possible combinations). Each player creates a road and circles achieved goals which give points on the scoresheet. The game ends when the action stack is empty. The player with the highest satisfaction score wins Citytrip Paris.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Atooi Collection
boardgame.description:
Atooi Collection on physical cartridge for the Nintendo 3DS. Limited to 4,000 copies available worldwide.

Includes the following titles: Mutant Mudds, Bomb Monkey, Xeodrifter, Mutant Mudds Super Challenge, and Chicken Wiggle.

Source: The Publisher Website.

boardgame.name: Bomb Monkey
boardgame.description: Blok Bombing is a fine and ancient sport invented by a small and creative troop of primates, called Bomb Monkeys. The goal is simple: do not allow the bloks rising from the jungle floor to reach dangerous heights and knock you from your perch.

boardgame.name: Chicken Wiggle
boardgame.description: The stars of Chicken Wiggle are an improbable duo: a young chicken and his best buddy a wiggly worm nestled in his backpack! Together, they team up for adventure to jump, peck, and worm-grapple across a myriad of perplexing platforming levels full of fun gadgets, tricky hazards, and sneaky foes determined to rescue their friends from the wicked witch in her sky towers.

boardgame.name: Amass
boardgame.description:
In Amass, deep space mining crews fight to gather resources on a hostile alien planet.

The goal of the game is to complete your mining contract while collecting the most valuable resources. Fight for resources scattered across the planet, raid resources from other crew encampments and look out for the hostile Alien raiders.

Each turn, new resources appear across the planet and the players secretly plan their crew actions. After all the crew placements are revealed, mining crews fight each other for the resources. Defeated crew members are placed on the wound tracker, where, in time, they will recover. Alien raiders roam around the map, stopping players mining locations and attacking crew encampments, crew can also fight these Aliens to gain new action cards, which they can use in future battles. The game ends when one player has succeeded in filling their base with resources.

The resources are then counted up, and the mining crew with the highest value of resources wins.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Arkosa
boardgame.description:
In Arkosa, you’ll be developing your bunker, recruiting unique new colonists and trying to keep your population happy, fed, rested and breathing.

However, the planet won’t make it easy for you. There’ll be regular attacks from the resident hostiles to contend with, plus a whole bunch of unique events that can occur to your intrepid explorers while they are out in the wastelands. In order to claim victory you’ll need a well organised, productive and happy bunker. But only one colony will win the grand prize... a ticket off the planet.

Each player will build and take charge of their own bunker. They will then compete to have the best reputation over the course of 3 rounds. Players will earn reputation points by recruiting new colonists, building new rooms, keeping their colony happy and making successful bribes. The player with the
most reputation points at the end of the game will be rescued from planet Arkosa and declared the winner. In the event of a tie, the colony with the highest morale will take the victory.

Arkosa is a 1-4 player, tableau and action pool building board game. The approximate playtime is around 25 minutes per player and the game is suitable for age 14+.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: The Carnival of Madness
boardgame.description:
Come One, Come All!

Everybody loves the circus! But it takes more than stale popcorn, some carnies, and few sad-looking caged animals to interest delvers. They demand magic, puzzles, fighting, and of course, loot – even (sometimes especially) when having fun during the downtime between dungeons.

GURPS Dungeon Fantasy Encounters 3: The Carnival of Madness provides all of that and more – much of it unexpected. This traveling show could show up in any place, at any time, spicing up the journey to or from the real adventure. Because it has its secrets, it's best not to say more, except . . .

Beware of the clowns!

- Publisher's description

boardgame.name: Struggle of Empires: Deluxe Metal Coins
boardgame.description: Metal coins to replace the cardboard gold tokens

boardgame.name: Cheeseboard Deluxe
boardgame.description:
There’s no appetizer so mouth-watering as a good cheeseboard. There’s a pleasure to timeless foods—meat, cheeses, fruits and grains—spread out like a savory work of art. These morsels combine in endless ways—do you want cheese and crackers? Crackers and meat? Cheese and fruit? Do you want to stack one of everything into a giant charcuterie sandwich?

But the real question is: can you make a good cheeseboard? The party is barely an hour from now! You have the ingredients, but they still need to be cut and served. It’s time to find out if you’ve got the chops to make a cheeseboard deluxe.

Cheeseboard Deluxe is a solitaire roll-and-write for one player, originally developed for the 2020 Solitaire Print-and-Play Contest. Your goal is to build a jam-packed cheeseboard, leaving as few empty spaces as possible at the end of the game.

Each round, you draw shapes representing food onto each of your cutting boards. When you can’t draw another shape onto a cutting board, that board is done, and when every board is done, the number of empty spaces remaining becomes your score. The more spaces you manage to fill in, the lower your score—and the better!

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Abnu's Children
boardgame.description:
From the publishers blurb:
Here are some tags/keywords to get your imagination going. Fugitive Heretics, Cursed worshippers, Ancient shrine, Jungle, Dust, cobwebs, and artifacts Abnu's Children is written for Agoth-Agog a new campaign setting in development by David Henley Productions. It is a short dungeon crawl in the classic style and playable with any game system. "Beware the children of Abnu, for they bear his curse..."

boardgame.name: PlayStation Vita Pets
boardgame.description: The player raises a virtual dog while also adventuring with them in a fictional realm. Using the touchscreen and microphone, the player can play with and manage a virtual dog.

boardgame.name: Śląscy Potentaci
boardgame.description: Card and resource management game about industrialization in XIXth century Upper Silesia. You are taking the role of one of the major Silesian aristocratic houses ( Ballestrem, Giesche, Henckel von Donnesmarck, Hochberg, Schaffgotsch). In-game you have to make 2 actions out of five: Influence, extraction, research, building,exchange. Influence is needed to build more advanced buildings. Research gives cards from the technology deck. These cards are advancement cards or event cards. In the game, you are collecting resources by drawing cards from the extraction deck. You are also expanding your house by raising buildings in different fields. These buildings are giving bonuses to area resources. They are also giving victory points needed to win the game. Exchange lets you trade resources with bank in proportions 1:3 (or 1:2 with the special building). The game ends when any player earns 27 victory points. There are optional variants: with constructing every building, or a faster variant with 21 victory points needed to end the game.

boardgame.name: Argentinum Astrum (Issue 1 - Sep 1995)
boardgame.description: The first ArAs contains short fiction, some cursed objects (for generic fantasy games), a Paranoia scenario, some short articles and a bunch of fanzine reviews.

boardgame.name: Argentinum Astrum (Issue 2 - Mar 1996)
boardgame.description: The second issue contains various short articles, a scenario seed (crime plot hook), an INS scenario, a remote island for Talislanta, and lots of reviews.

boardgame.name: Railway Empire - Down Under
boardgame.description:
Kalypso Media and Gaming Minds Studios today launched the next DLC for Railway Empire, ‘Down Under‘. In the series’ second visit to the Southern Hemisphere, Down Under DLC moves the beloved rail tycoon sim to the sun-scorched plains of the Australian outback.

The DLC adds four additional territories, New South Wales, Queensland, South Australia and Victoria, and allows players to discover 52 new cities, customise settlements, and trade goods customary to the continent, such as beer and grilled seafood.

During the first half of the 19th Century, the colonial territories of Australia are sparsely populated and consist primarily of coastal cities and a few smaller farming settlements in the remote outback. However, a series of events is set to spark an industrial revolution, one that will usher in an era of change for Australia and secure a lucrative future for the fledgling nation. In Railway Empire Down Under DLC, it is up to you to tame the unforgiving outback and expand your railway network across its wild terrain and beyond. Your railway will ultimately be the key to laying the foundations for flourishing cities and to connecting remote mining settlements to coastal metropolises. Are you ready to face the sun-scorched landscape of Australia’s Red Centre?

Features:


New scenario: ‘Pioneering Spirit’ (1830-1930)
Map expansion: ‘Down Under’ (available in Free Game and Sandbox modes)
Explore new territories: New South Wales, Queensland, South Australia and Victoria
3 new historical engines: Heisler (0-8-0). C30 (4-6-0) and Class S (4-6-2)
New goods to trade: seafood, Rail-O-Mite and canned beer)
52 new cities to discover
New music, reworked city buildings and unique mission structures (e.g. Sydney Harbour Bridge)
Unique ‘Settlement’ feature for pre-determined locations
More freedom to establish new cities and personalise economic systems


Source: The Publisher Website.

boardgame.name: Railway Empire - Northern Europe
boardgame.description:
The Northern Europe expansion sees players aid the Swedish Parliament with constructing a new national railroad to continue the country’s far-reaching industrial advancements along the lakes and sprawling rivers that were first used by freight ships to provide goods and supplies to Northern Europe.

The new DLC includes:


New scenario: Hibernation (1853-1870)
Map expansion: ‘Northern Europe’ (available in Free Game and Sandbox modes)
3 historical engines: Odin (2-2-2), Prins August (2-4-0) and SJB II (4-6-0)
10 new tradeable goods (e.g. crisp bread and brown cheese) and 30 new cities
‘Concession’ feature: The map is divided into sections. Buy concessions to gain access to new building grounds (also available on the full North American map)
Snow: Enhanced weather system for all northern regions in the game
New regional soundtrack


Source: The Publisher Website.

boardgame.name: Crowded Cave Adventures
boardgame.description:
Crowded Cave Adventures is a Dungeon Crawler, Roguelike RPG Card Game within layers of narrative chapters. You manage your heroes, filling up their backpack with artifacts, fairies and scrolls, completing quests and defeating pixel art monsters and bosses.

It's an open world board game in which you'll be exploring up to 15 "Cave Worlds", all connected together. There are more than 1700 cards to discover and an infinity amount of power combinations depending on the hero's class, Guild and the rarity of the legendary treasures found inside the Caves...

Up to 4 players can either team up or compete in order to be the richest, the most powerful adventurer or the one who discovers the true nature of this amazing universe. When the main boss is defeated, the Run ends!

Draw a card, interact with it, explore more, fight monsters and stay wise in order to save your hero's life. Should'nt you come back to your camp now before it's too late?

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Kingdoms of Amalur: Re-Reckoning
boardgame.description:
The hit RPG returns! From the minds of the bestselling author R. A. Salvatore, Spawn creator Todd McFarlane, and The Elder Scrolls IV: Oblivion lead designer Ken Rolston comes Kingdoms of Amalur: Re-Reckoning. Remastered with extended content, stunning visuals, and refined gameplay, KoA delivers intense, customizable RPG combat inside a sprawling game world.

Uncover the secrets of Amalur, from the vibrant city of Rathir to the vast region of Dalentarth to the grim dungeons of the Brigand Hall Caverns.

Rescue a world torn apart by a vicious war and control the keys to immortality as the first warrior ever to be resurrected from the grips of death.

Enjoy countless sidequests rich in political intrigue, romance, sinister magics and even whimsy – all central to the primary mission.

Extend your experience in Amalur with all DLC from the original release, from Teeth of Naros to Legend of Dead Kel and more!

Improved graphical fidelity including Native 4K support!

Source: The Game Website.
boardgame.videogameversion: North American Xbox One Collectors edition
boardgame.videogamecompilation: Kingdoms of Amalur: Reckoning – Teeth of Naros
Kingdoms of Amalur: Reckoning – The Legend of Dead Kel

boardgame.name: King of Potato
boardgame.description:
King of Potato is a cardgame where the king is missing and players will take turns to get him. At the end of their turn, the player will get a victory coin for having the King. You will need three victory coins to win.

You will have cards that will look for the King, but other players will steal the King by interfering your play and playing fast cards on your turn.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: 1244: The Fall of Montsegur
boardgame.description:
1244: The Fall of Montsegur is a strategic board game inspired by the historical event. One player takes on the role of commanding the crusading army. The other player takes on the role of commanding the defense of Montsegur. In a series of turns the players fight to gain control of the area around Montsegur and the souls of the Cathars trapped inside the castle. At the end of the siege, victory points are scored to determine if the Cathar faith survives the fall.

The goal in 1244: The Fall of Montsegur is to claim the majority of the souls of the Cathar perfects trapped inside the castle. The inquisitors of the Crusaders try to get the misguided to repent, while the Cathars perfects try to escape or to have faith to make the final sacrifice: Burn for their belief.

The religious struggle takes place on the background of a military campaign, where each side strives to gain control of the battlefield and to endure the hardships of the long siege.

In a number of turns each representing roughly one month of the siege, each player in turn plays cards to advance his goals and to sabotage his opponent. Each card can either be played for the point value on the card to take one of the standard actions or be played for the event on the card. Some events benefit solely the Cathars, others the Crusaders, and some can benefit both depending on who plays it and what the position on the board is. In every turn one card from each player's hand is not played but is kept for the final scoring.

-description from publisher's website

boardgame.name: >Hacknet_
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

>My name is Bit, and if you're reading this, then I'm already dead.

>Maybe that fact is surprising, considering this somehow got into your hands. Was it by chance? Maybe Vapor found this and decided to give this to you. In any case, what you're holding is one of the most advanced pieces of programming this world has to offer, Hacknet.

boardgame.name: The Bank Job
boardgame.description:
You and your cohorts of crime have just pulled off the most successful bank heist of the century, including the theft of one of the world's most valuable diamonds. You must lay low for a week and guard your take; there's no honor amongst thieves here, and everyone wants the most they can get. Plus, rumors are there's a snake in your midst that might be out to get the prize jewel for themselves, and a rat could be trying to foil the whole operation.

Each player will be dealt a random crew card to tell you what your part in this band of thieves is. These are not hidden from other players, since teamwork is dreamwork, after all. Each person brings their own unique talent, or specialty, to the crew, usable throughout the game. You will also be given a random role card, possibly giving you a secret double agent part to play. These should not be shared and will affect how you can win the game. There are four regular crew member cards, one snake card, and one rat card. As with any squad, the more people you bring in, the likelier it is to have defectors.

The game is played over the course of seven rounds, or days. Every day will begin with players taking turns to choose their actions for the day by placing a token on the box next to the action of their choice. For morning actions, you will use the numbers on your crew cards to determine turn order. After that, turn order is based on the last round's actions going from top to bottom on the action card in the center of the table.

Your goal, as the thief you are, is to hoodwink your way through the week, exchanging loot with players and the score to end up with the best take for yourself. Don't get too greedy, though! If you end up with more than the score, your zealousness will be shown, and the crew will take you out. The prized diamond is also supposed to be shared, so any crew member holding it at the end will mark you for an early demise, as well. Additionally, the bank loaded a tracker into the loot that will get you caught and disqualified if you're holding it at the end.

—description from the designer
boardgame.boardgameimplementation: The Bank Job: Mint Tin Edition

boardgame.name: Oathmark: Oathbreakers
boardgame.description:
Dark necromancers have laid claim to forsaken kingdoms and summoned forth the souls of those who defiled their oathmarks.
The dead, once again, march to war.
As armies of wraiths and skeletal warriors bring destruction to their lands, the small kingdoms of the Marches also turn to the spirits of the dead.
Gathering the most ancient and powerful of oathmarks, they recall the spectral forms of those that died in loyal battle to once again come forth in defence of their kingdoms. With these ethereal warriors joining their ranks, the kings of the Marches may yet stand.

This supplement for Oathmark: Battles of the Lost Age introduces the forces of the dead to the game.
Some armies will use dark magic to summon the souls and corpses of traitors from the past, while others will recall the spirits of loyal warriors that gave their lives and willingly fight again.

This book also includes expanded rules for characters, which allow you to chart their progress from battle-to-battle, and watch as they grow in rank, responsibility, and power. All of these rules are then incorporated into a campaign featuring new scenarios that together tell of an epic war for survival.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Old Friends Bearing Guns: Five Parsecs Scenario 5
boardgame.description:
Scenario 5 for Five Parsecs From Home is a blast from the past.. literally, as your captain realizes an old enemy of theirs is gunning for their head.

Old friends bearing guns can be added into any campaign, though it is best suited for a crew with a little bit of experience. It contains a sequence of 3 linked encounter battles forming a small story, along with tables to generate your old nemesis.

If you do well, you may even get a custom weapon out of the deal!

This is an expansion pack for Five Parsecs From Home 2nd edition.

You require a copy of the core game rules. The pack is compatible with your existing expansions, but none are required.

boardgame.name: Battlestar Galactica: Starship Battles – Additional Counter Set
boardgame.description:
In Battlestar Galactica – Starship Battles, players take control of Colonial and Cylon spaceships and face each other in furious dogfights and daring missions. The innovative game system features easy to learn rules, a unique set of maneuver cards for each spaceship, and two exclusive devices — the control panel and the rotating miniature base (included in each Spaceship Pack).

You will be able to relive the exciting combat sequences from the TV series on your tabletop, just a few minutes after opening the box!

This set, Battlestar Galactica – Additional Counter Set Expansion Pack, includes four punchboards with the full set of damage counters, special counters and markers as FTL markers, special templates as Asteroid Fields, Planetoid and Spaceship base templates, and all the cardboard accessories from the Battlestar Galactica Starship Battles Starter Set.

Increase the number of spaceships you can play with, and the variety of scenarios you can play, with this Additional Counter Set.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Valda: Rise of the Giants
boardgame.description:
SUMMARY
Valda: Rise of the Giants is a an expansion to Valda. As in the base game, it is a power-building strategy game where you as a viking warchief use divine powers, manage a village and resources, play powerful spells and build temples. You gather followers, fight off enemies and climb the steps to divinity.

This expansion gives you the chance to discover the power of the Giants. 15 new cards for the base deck and 68 new Giant cards that offer you brand new powers with never before-seen graphics. A new powerful resource, 7 Giant powers, double sided action tokens and 5 new player boards complete this expansion.

STORY
All was peace and quiet in Asgard. The Gods continued being worshipped and led their easy immortal life. Until Hel, Queen of the Underworld wanted to broaden her empire. She seduces Surtur to form a powerful alliance. Thirsty for destruction Surtur calls his fellow brethren to reclaim their territory. After decades of hiding the Giants rise again. War is among us.

HOW TO PLAY (AND WIN)
In Valda: the Rise of the Giants, you now have a choice between Gods and Giants and their powers to use to your advantage.
Now every player finishes 4 phases during their turn. The player starts with the Valda phase where he/she scavenge and explore the newly formed world by drafting and playing cards and actions. Building temples in the different God or Giant domains is an important way to gain divine abilities, and get access to more powerful spells. The attack phase is played similar to the base game. So every player can attack the player in turn once. In the follower phase you worship a God or Giant by building a temple in the specific God or Giant area. Resources (divine blood, gold, diamonds, runes), cards or (dice) eyes can be transferred into followers. In the last phase you roll dice to harvest rare resources for your tribe.

The viking chieftan who has the most followers when the ship arrives in Asgard, is worthy enough to climb the world tree Yggdrasil and becomes a God! Oh.. and he/she also wins the game.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Prêt Feu Go!
boardgame.description:
Prêt Feu Go is a friendly and festive game for your evenings with friends. The game is in French only.

Small format, very simple rules, unlimited number of players and lasting from 5 minutes to hours, it will adapt to all your events: dinners with friends, aperitifs on the terrace, WE in the countryside, team-buildings, rave-party, birthdays, weddings and bachelor(ette) parties!

The Chief asks 1 question to another player, who needs to give 3 answers within 5 seconds. If the player manages to give 3 or more correct answers during these 5 seconds: IT'S WON, he wins the question card which represents 1 point, and the next player is to answer.

Please note: the Chief is all-powerful and it is up to him to decide whether the answers given are accepted (especially for subjective questions!). Once all the players have been interviewed, the Chief chooses the player who will become the new Chief, and off you go for another round!

The winner is the first to get 6 points… or the player with the most points when you decide to end the game.

You will find six categories: Culture, Non censured, Your life-your point of view, France, unclassifiable, things.

listing.notes: Game in French, never used. Jeu jamais utilisé.

boardgame.name: まじかる☆ベーカリー(Magical Bakery)
boardgame.description:
Players are apprentice wizards working in a magical bakery. They use magic spells and cooperation from other players to bake all of the ordered pastries.

Each turn, a player either looks at a baked good card or goes home early (placing one money in the center as a tip.) If they look at the baked good card, they can add it to the stack of orders to be fulfilled, or discard it and hide one of the eight notes with the magic spells on them.

When only one player remains, they attempt to bake all of the bread. Each bread card has a die combination that needs to be made. They only get a single roll, but the remaining spell cards will help them reroll or manipulate the dice, and they can bribe other players to reroll the dice for them.

If a player succeeds, they earn the tip pool and the value of all of the items they baked. If they fail, they get nothing; the second time they fail, they are fired (eliminated from the game.)

The goal is to be the first to get to a set goal of money, or the last person still employed.

boardgame.name: Trodox (Issue 50 - Nov 2020)
boardgame.description:
Trodox -Ars Arcana Nr.50

40 Seiten A5 (Schwerpunkthema: Malmsturm-Abenteuer)

● Malmsturm-Abenteuer Ujordings Fluch (22 Seiten - ein Fluch und seine Folgen)
● Gedanken zum Rollspiel Rollenspiel & ROLLENspiel (8 Seiten) ● Nichtspielercharakter Die Kriegerprinzessin (5 Seiten)

boardgame.name: Impractical Jokers the Game
boardgame.description:
Think you've got what it takes to be one of the Jokers? Now's your chance to put yourself to the test. In this three part game players first try and pull off challenges in front of unsuspecting guests. Once the gag is up, players then face off in a charades-like card game to see who can match the most awkward one liners in response to funny scenarios. The night's biggest loser is subject to a surprise punishment of epic proportions.

—description from the publisher

In the first part of this party game, each player is given a card that issues them some sort of awkward and funny challenge to complete in front of an unsuspecting person (nothing dangerous, gross or illegal, all challenges are silly and require no physical contact). The second phase of the game has players receiving cards with a scenario and the other players respond to this scenario with pre-written one-liners on cards of their own. Points are tallied from both phases and a loser is declared-- whoever has the least amount of points-- and this losing player receives a card that delivers them some sort of silly "punishment".

Note: This edition was a Walgreen exclusive.

—description from the publisher (translated)
boardgame.boardgamefamily: Organizations: Board Games Association of Creators in Spain (LUDO)

boardgame.name: Otto Game Over
boardgame.description:
OTTO is a surprising game: it’s as simple as it’s complex. We can only tell you about some of the incredible features that make it so special. Not all of them can be described, but you can sense them as you play, and these sensations lead you to something bigger, something deeply connected to other worlds and civilizations.

The game is based on the modularity of the never ending connection between all cards. You can literally pick them up and randomly place them on the chessboard: coherent designs with infinite combinations will always come to life. However that’s not the game.

Being completely deprived of any setting, the game can be defined as ‘universal’, as it’s based on visual perception of symbolic geometries. OTTO is the most abstract game ever, with a unique and original design, perhaps even extraterrestrial.

The game hangs in the balance between strategy, the vision of future opportunities, chance, and the player’s style. In playing OTTO you will always discover new strategies, unforeseeable scenarios and complete situation reversals up to the last move.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Warhammer Age of Sigmar: Wrath of the Everchosen
boardgame.description:
The Great Necromancer, Nagash, initiates an all-out war to end all life in the Mortal Realms, but in order to complete his monumental task he needs access to them. And so he turns his gaze to the Eightpoints, ruled over by none other than Archaon Everchosen, Exalted Grand Marshall of the Apocalypse.

The vast armies of the dead, led by Nagash’s chief lieutenant, Katakros, march for the nigh-impenetrable fortress of Chaos – the Varanspire. Archaon does not take this challenge lightly, and seeks aid from a powerful force, long believed to be lost… But will it be enough to halt the legions of the dead?

Wrath of the Everchosen advances the story of Warhammer Age of Sigmar with Realm-shaking events that will have far-reaching consequences for many factions. You'll learn why Nagash needs to conquer the region to complete his infernal work, and watch the ebb and flow of the invasion as it progresses.

On top of the action-packed story, this book includes a painting guide, and enhanced rules for your Chaos Grand Alliance armies.

—description from the publisher
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Warhammer Age of Sigmar (Second Edition) Core Rules

boardgame.name: Gewölbe und Drache
boardgame.description:
Im Steinforst ließ sich vor kurzem der grüne Drachennestling Patarax in einer ehemaligen Räuberhöhle am Rande der Tannhügel nieder. Sein giftiger Atem verdirbt die Umgebung, Ranken und Dornebüsche wachsen und die friedliebenden Kreaturen des Waldes meiden den Hügel und Orks und Kultisten haben sich niedergelassen…

Ein Einführungsabenteuer für eine erfahrene Spielleitung und eine Gruppe von Rollenspielanfänger:innen.

Dieses Fan-Abenteuer erscheint ausschließlich als gedrucktes A5-Heft direkt vom Autor.

boardgame.name: Hoch hinaus
boardgame.description:
Each player, if no more than 5, gets a red wooden disc. On your turn, place a white disc on the table if it is the first one. If not, stack it on the disc tower. When you think the tower will crash before it's your turn again, place a red disc. If it's your turn again, pay a chip. When the tower crashes, the player who caused it pays 4 chips, other players with still their red disc in possession pay 2. If you are out of chips, you're out of the game. The last player with chips wins.

—user summary

boardgame.name: In the Shadow of Aufstrag
boardgame.description:
From the publisher's web site:

In the Shadow of Aufstrag Box Set Includes the Following:

Castles & Crusades Adventure Modules A0-A5
Map Booklet for quick reference
Area Map of the Blacktooth Ridge and Environs
Encounter Chart for the Blacktooth Ridge

For a thousand years Unklar, the Horned God, ruled from his throne in the great towers of Aufstrag. His rule ended in the long Winter Dark Wars and the heroes of that age swept him away and into the Great Empty. Amidst the ruins of his rule a new world was born.

But memories run deep and the stain of Unklar’s reign is not so easily rooted out. His minions haunt the dark places of the world. They occupy forgotten temples, ruined dungeons, castles on the borderlands; from these bastions they plot the return of their horned master, or at the very least, the terror of men. There is perhaps no greater bastion for the refugees of Aufstrag than the Blacktooth Ridge. Here evil resides, and thrives; treasures abound, hidden magic lies unused and forgotten. There is wealth and bounty ripe for the taking, and land and title for those so interested.

In this wild country, in the very shadow of Aufstrag, the Umbrage Saga begins.

In the Shadow of Aufstrag is an adventure for 3-8 low to mid-level characters. It contains overland and dungeon adventures and sets the characters on the Journey to Aufstrag. There is enough setting material and adventure hooks to allow the CK to create multiple adventures.

In the Shadow of Aufstrag includes the following adventure modules:

A0 Rising Knight
A1 Assault on Blacktooth Ridge
A2 Slag Heap
A3 Wicked Cauldron
A4 Usurpers of the Fell Axe
A5 The Shattered Horn

In the Shadow of Aufstrag is a prelude to Journey to Aufstrag (A6-A12) and Dungeons of Aufstrag (A13-A17).

boardgame.name: Dante Alighieri: Comedia – Inferno
boardgame.description:
The Divine Comedy by Dante Alighieri begins among the punishments of sins and ends with the beatitudes of virtues. Join Dante and Virgil in their journey through the Circles of Hell until... we again behold the stars.

Through a "spiral" draft, players must collect Encounter cards with different numbers (possibly just a single copy) in order to convert their value into Victory points at the end of the game. Character cards, on the other hand, are helpful support cards which give control certain mechanics but, at the end of the game, having the supremacy of the Characters penalizes in any tie-break for victory.

-description from publisher

CONCORDIA SOLITARIA may be played on any of the maps and with any other expansion for CONCORDIA.

Requires either the base game CONCORDIA or CONCORDIA VENUS to play.

standard, veteran and expert

boardgame.name: DIG!
boardgame.description:
Super colorful HOWEVER an Icon-Driven card play design allows for 100% Colorblind Compatibility gameplay!

Fast play, quick card discovery action. Players bury (deal) piles of cards that contain various items, at increasing card values as the item itself is more valuable.

Players then search for these buried treasures, by using o of 4 different tools in the hand. the starting tool, as a Spoon and Fork, is the least likely digging apparatus! As such, you can peek at the top card in a pile with the spoon, and upon returning to that card on a later turn, DIG! it up with the fFork.

Players can upgrade their tools to DIG! faster by trading in found treasures for a Rake, Spade and Shovel. As players upgrade to these better tools, the no longer peek at piles, instead DIG! up cards right away.

Find more treasures per turn with each upgraded tool.... and avoid hidden bombs laced within the piles! Discover a bomb, loose your collected loot, and start your treasure collections all over again.

The player with the most treasure by the time all the piles are uncovered, wins!

With gameplay under 10 minutes, there is more than meets the eye. When do you upgrade? How many holes do you DIG! Can you avoid the bombs and leaving your opponent no other choices?

Fun, Fast, Gamer/NonGamer, All-Ages Excitement! 2 Players per deck, add a second deck for fully supported 4-player action.

-description from publisher

boardgame.name: Devil May Cry: The Bloody Palace – Devil Trigger Expansion
boardgame.description:
Are you ready to unleash your inner demons? Release that destructive power with the Devil Trigger expansion! Activate Devil Trigger to introduce incredible new forms and exciting new move sets for Dante, Nero, and Trish. Not to be left behind, V can summon his third and most powerful demonic familiar, Nightmare, to gain a new level of control over the battlefield. Plus, this expansion introduces additional rules to step up Lady’s game (The Walking Arsenal expansion), so she can compete with the Devil Trigger-enhanced Hunters (and the dreaded Nightmare)!

Contents:
1x Sin Devil Trigger Nero mini
1x Sin Devil Trigger Dante mini
1x Sin Devil Trigger Trish mini
1x Nightmare mini
Over 80 cards
All the tokens, markers, and gauges you need to play!

-description from publisher's website
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Devil May Cry: The Bloody Palace

boardgame.name: Devil May Cry: The Bloody Palace – The Alpha & The Omega Expansion
boardgame.description:
Bring a whole new level of carnage to your games of Devil May Cry™: The Bloody Palace with four terrifying new enemies! Brace yourself the spinning, spiked Chaos, and the bladed, teleporting Fury. Still hungry for more? Then take on two highly anticipated bosses! One is the power-hungry demon Urizen, the Usurper. The other is the most iconic boss enemy in Devil May Cry™ history— Vergil: the Alpha and the Omega.

Contents
2x Fury minis
1x Chaos mini
1x Vergil mini
1x Sin Devil Trigger Vergil mini
1x Urizen mini
Over 60 cards
All the tokens and markers you'll need to play!

-description from publisher's website
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Devil May Cry: The Bloody Palace

boardgame.name: ISS Vanguard
boardgame.description:
ISS Vanguard is a 1-4 player co-operative, campaign Board Game. It will bring players right into epic Sci-Fi adventure, as they will play as 4 sections (security, recon, science, engineering) onboard the first human ship with the possibility to reach outer space. Campaign will introduce the unique story written by Krzysztof Piskorski (Tainted Grail) full of hard player choices, twists and branching storylines. The game will come with over 100 different Crew members, each with unique characteristics.

Gameplay is divided into 2 main stages: Ship phase and landing on planets.

During the Ship phase, players will manage their ship (binder with printed sleeves), where every section will have to make gameplay decisions. Then, you will prepare your crew for landing on the next planet, in search of answers to humanity's biggest questions. Together you will pick lander and customize it with modules, then each section will choose a crew member to take on a mission ( more experienced crew members will have better ranks ), deck-build skills deck, take equipment and choose dices for his character.

During all phases of the games players will be directed to Log-book, consisting story encounters, often written in the form of action-packed dialogues between the characters.
boardgame.boardgamepodcastepisode: Episode 67: Oriflamme, Paladins of the West Kingdom, Dwellings of Eldervale
