boardgame.name: Fury of Dracula Digital Edition
boardgame.description:
Dracula is ready to take over Europe and only four iconic vampire hunters can stop him, in this digital adaptation of the classic board game of deduction and gothic horror. Play locally with friends or 1v1 online. Will you be the hunter or the hunted?
...
Discover the original game of gothic horror and social deduction, as you hunt Dracula across Europe and try to survive the approaching darkness.
Publisher's description

boardgame.name: 1400 Quest
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

1400 Quest is lo-fi hi-fantasy. The borderlands are bad, and the cities aren’t much better. Brave heroes adventure into the unknown to slay dangerous beasts and explore magic-tainted ruins in search of wealth and renown.

1400 Quest is a stand-alone table-top RPG. The rules are short and easy to learn and the whole game can fit on a single sheet of paper. It can be played using just the rules provided, or combined with 1400 Below to expand the world and provide more character and game options.

The main rules and character creation fit on one page, with two more pages containing items, spells, pets, vehicles, and character options, as well as tables to help the DM populate the world with quirky NPCs, fantastic locations, and dangerous monsters, as well as create adventures and plot hooks.

boardgame.name: 1400 Below
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

1400 Below is lo-fi hi-fantasy dungeon crawl. Labyrinthine caverns connect lost cities and antediluvian tombs filled with monsters and madness, but most importantly, hidden and unremembered treasures. Plunge into perilous hollows, traverse long forgotten mines, or fight for your life in trapped sanctums as you explore the world below.

1400 Below is a stand-alone table-top RPG. The rules are short and easy to learn and the whole game can fit on a single sheet of paper. It can be played using just the rules provided, or combined with 1400 Quest to expand the world and provide more character and game options .

The main rules and character creation fit on one page with two more pages containing character details, mundane and magical items, spells, as well as tables to help the DM populate the world with powerful NPCs, fantastic dungeon locations, and craft dangerous monsters.

boardgame.name: Swords & Sorcery
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

You are an adventuring party for the Fissure’s Breach Adventurers’ Guild. You are tasked with exploring the world to uncover lost treasures, solve mysteries, and defeat evil.

Swords and Sorcery is an OSR fantasy hack of Lasers & Feelings. The rules for this game fit on a single page, and can be picked up and played with minimal prep, and with just a few six-sided dice.

One player becomes the Guild Manager (GM) while the rest create player characters (PCs). The GM is responsible for sending the PCs out into the world on adventures to have fun, make money, and keep the kingdom safe.

boardgame.name: The Secret RPG Crossoverse
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

The Secret RPG Crossoverse is a multiversal role-playing game where players create characters from any genre, in secret, without knowing the setting in which the game is taking place.

You can be a space marine, an eleven warrior, a magical girl, a teen detective, an anthropomorphic talking horse, or something else entirely. It’s the ultimate crossover episode.

boardgame.name: Blood Bowl (Second Season Edition): Necromantic Horror Team Card Pack
boardgame.description:
Redesigned with the Second Season ruleset in mind, this deck of 44 cards will help you keep track of stats and profiles your team, positions, and Star Players – plus Special Play cards exclusively for use with Necromantic Horror teams.

CONTENTS
– 5 Player reference cards for Zombie Linemen, Ghoul Runners, Wraiths, Flesh Golems, and Werewolves
– 3 Star Player cards for Frank ’n’ Stein, Wilhelm Chaney, and Bryce ‘The Slice’ Cambuel
– 8 Random Event Special Play cards
– 8 Magical Memorabilia Special Play cards
– 19 Blank Player cards: 11 Zombie Linemen, 2 Ghoul Runners, 2 Wraiths, 2 Flesh Golems, and 2 Werewolves
– The all-important card explaining how to use the cards, with a red card on the reverse

You’ll need a copy of Blood Bowl: The Official Rules and Spike! Journal 11 to make full use of these cards.

boardgame.name: Blood Bowl (Second Season Edition): Special Plays Card Pack
boardgame.description:
This deck of 64 cards contains all of the universal Special Plays available to every team as inducements in the new edition of Blood Bowl, broken down into handy categories. You’ll also find reminder cards for the results of the Prayers to Nuffle table from the book.

You won’t find these Special Plays anywhere else, so make sure you secure a copy of this deck if you want to take advantage of these strategic inducements to help even the odds.

CONTENTS
– 8 Benefits of Training Special Play cards
– 8 Dirty Tricks Special Play cards
– 8 Heroic Feats Special Play cards
– 8 Magical Memorabilia Special Play cards
– 8 Miscellaneous Mayhem Special Play cards
– 8 Random Events Special Play cards
– 16 Prayers to Nuffle reminder cards

You’ll need a copy of Blood Bowl: The Official Rules to make full use of these cards.

boardgame.name: Blood Bowl (Second Season Edition): Necromantic Horror Team Pitch
boardgame.description:
Necromantic Horror teams are right at home amongst the macabre and supernatural. What better location for a stadium than within a Sylvanian graveyard? Necromancer coaches often try to convince their counterpart to begin playing just as daylight fades, hoping the chill of the night saps the other players’ strength and invigorates their own.

This double-sided board depicts a dusky, barren cemetery pitch on one side, replete with tombs and flagstone walkways, and littered with pumpkins, skulls, and freshly-dug open graves – ready for the next victim. On the other side, the same scene but after the sun has set, with eerie witchfire in the eyes of the pumpkins (and skulls!) and the Necromantic Horror icon in the center of the field.

The package includes two redesigned dugouts for the new edition of the game. They match the creepy dusk to dawn aesthetics of the pitch – each dugout featuring Score, Turn, and Re-roll trackers, plus Reserves, Knocked-out, and Casualty boxes. You'll also find rules to represent the particular features of both sides of the pitch.

Necromantic Horror teams are compatible with the 2016 Edition of Blood Bowl using the "Teams of Legend" optional rules published by Games-Workshop.

boardgame.name: Monopoly: Brugge
boardgame.description:
The Monopoly Brugge edition of the game remains true to the original concept but was given a Bruges look in terms of content and graphics.
All locations are filled in with well-known streets, squares and sights of Bruges.

Not only the locations, but also the graphical design radiates Bruges.
The box, the board and the properties are given a Bruges look & feel.
Also, the Community Chest and Chance cards have not only been changed in terms of look and feel, but are also interspersed with numerous Bruges references.

Only 4000 made.

boardgame.name: Blood Bowl (Second Season Edition): Necromantic Horror Dice Set
boardgame.description:
A set of uniquely-colored Blood Bowl dice.

3 Blood Bowl Block dice
2 6-sided dice (with the team icon in place of the 6)
1 8-sided dice
1 16-sided dice

boardgame.name: ロールライト ⚅富豪 (Roll Write Daifugō)
boardgame.description:
In ロールライト⚅富豪 (Roll Write Daifugō), two to six (or up to 99) players compete in a roll and write game which will determine the hands they will use in the second half of the game -a shedding game where the first player to play all of their cards will win!

In the roll and write half, a player rolls three dice and the players write the values in a colored area on their board. Each player also has a limited ability to adjust the value of the dice in this round. Once complete, the players sum the columns on their sheet as shown to determine the ranks of the "cards" in their hand.

In the shedding half, the players play a game based on the traditional structure known as Daifugō, where the start player will play one or more cards of the same rank, and other players can either pass, or play the same number of cards, but of a higher rank.

The first player to "play" all of their "cards" wins the game!
boardgame.boardgamepublisher: Ponkotsu Farm (ぽんこつファーム)

boardgame.name: LEO (400-800km)
boardgame.description:
Low Earth Orbit (LEO) is the most crowed area of space. 1000s of spacecraft pass overhead and orbit slots are hotly contested. Take control of your LEO spacecraft, manage its resources to deliver the maximum data back to the ground.

In LEO (400-800km) players take control of a spacecraft in Low Earth Orbit. Each turn they move their spacecraft to the next orbit card and resolve the events on that card (discharge battery, damage memory, use thrusters to maintain orbit, place new orbit card).

After the events, the player can then take one of the following actions:

Adjust orbit (either moving up to a higher orbit, or down to a lower orbit),
Recharge battery,
Activate instruments (storing science or image data in their memory area)
Downlink data (remove science & image data from the memory area and score points on the science and image track)


As the game progresses players will be eliminated as they run out of fuel and can no longer maintain their orbit.
Once all players have been eliminated, the player with highest, lowest scoring track is the winner.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Catfight
boardgame.description:
Catfight is a very fast two-player card game in which players compete to have the strongest gang by trying to collect as many different cats as possible. Each turn, they draw two cards then either discard one card or lay down a set of cards. To lay down a set, you need at least two cards if the same gang member hasn't been played or more cards than are already on the table if it has been played. Any cards of the same gang member on the table are discarded. The round ends when one player has five different gang members, OR the draw pile is exhausted. When the draw pile is exhausted, players score for the different gang members they have laid down in front of them.

Just like in a fighting game, Catfight is played as "first-to-2", or I think it's also known as best of three.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Urban Slums Expansion
boardgame.description:
Paraphrased from publisher's blurb:

24 double-sided 6"×6" map tiles that can be used to navigate the seedy side of town and dodge pickpockets, evade the law among ramshackle buildings, tumble with dangerous ruffians hiding in dark alleyways, or infiltrate a clandestine thieves' den

Can be combined with other urban flip-tiles sets.

Wet, dry, and permanent markers erasable.

boardgame.name: Darklands Fire Caves Expansion
boardgame.description:
Paraphrased from publisher's blurb:

24 double-sided 6"×6" map tiles that can be used to navigate twisting tunnels, brave bubbling rivers of magma, or explore the lava tubes twisting below a volcanic mountain range.

Can be combined with other Darklands flip-tiles sets.

Wet, dry, and permanent markers erasable.

boardgame.name: Galaxy Cannon Rider
boardgame.description:
User Summary

Jump from cannon to cannon collecting stars as you travel around the galaxy.

boardgame.name: El Jurado 3: El caso del tapón de vino
Intime Conviction n°3: L'Affaire du bouchon de Liège
За закрытыми дверями: Дело о винной пробке
boardgame.description:
Sick prank or well-orchestrated vengeance? The gala just started and was going so well…

Jurors, will you make the right decision?
Slip into the shoes of a juror, judge a criminal case and deliver your verdict.

Play with friends for an evening by recreating the atmosphere of a closed session! Or make the fun last by revealing only a few items a day!

"Intime Conviction n°3: L’Affaire du bouchon de Liège is the third instalment of the series of murder solving game by Editions Fika

Content:
- 1 Rule of the game
- 1 Board
- 12 Juror Cards
- 24 Final Voting Cards
- 4 sealed Investigation sheets
- 1 FINAL REVELATION envelope

Intime conviction is a craft object entirely designed, made and assembled by hand and in Belgium. The format of the game is unusual as well: the whole game fits in an envelope.

—description of a distributor.

Two ways to play:
- In group: Play with friends at a party by recreating the closed door ambiance (about 2h game)
- in duo: Make it last by revealing only a few new elements every day.

How to play (condensed):
Place the crime scene in the middle of the table and give each player a Juror card.
Inspect the crime scene, then read the defendant's deposition. Reveal the Juror cards one by one.
When the Jury is ready to vote, the final vote takes place. If a majority isn't reached, the debate continues until someone switches sides.

The verdict is announced, a final revelation is unveiled (brand new information is discovered).
You win if you settled on the right decision.
You loose if the verdict was inadequate.

boardgame.name: Zipple World
boardgame.description:
This is the story of Zipple, a frog warrior who must collect the objects scattered in his world of mazes and then bring them into the homes of her village.

To pass each level you have to transport a certain number of objects (scattered in the maze) in the houses of the village. All that by running, jumping and killing enemies.

There are various types of enemies of various species, and there are movable obstacles and bonuses falling from the sky. You can also kill enemies by jumping on them.

Source: The Developer Website.

boardgame.name: Zipple World 2: The Sweet Chaos
boardgame.description:
The story of Zipple continues.

The frog warrior this time must save the companions of the village and bring them in the houses scattered in the playing field.

To pass each level you have to transport a certain number of frogs (scattered in the playfield) in the houses of the village. All that by running, jumping and killing enemies.

Source: The Developer Website.

boardgame.name: Sign
Sign: A Game About Being Understood
boardgame.description:
To be understood, we need to communicate. And communicating isn't always easy.

Sign is a game for 4 to 7 players that runs in about two hours. It's based on the true story of a language born in modern times from the hands of children. The history of Nicaraguan Sign Language is profound and powerful and human. We need stories like that; we should hold them close.

In Sign, you'll play as kids on their first day of school. Together you'll make new language through play.
boardgame.rpg: Sign: A Game about Being Understood

boardgame.name: Evergreen Bandana Game
boardgame.description: The Evergreen Bandana Game is an adventure board game where players roll to race across the state. Along the way players will encounter unique Washington obstacles and have a chance to speed up their advancement when they risk a roll of the adventure dice. The game is comes printed on a durable cloth bandana.

boardgame.name: LOL: Le jeu
boardgame.description:
With over 500 comedic scenes inspired from the universe of the television series LOL ComediHa! ? to choose from, the players will have to recreate the scenes originally brought to life by the comedians.

The Judges team will have to guess whatever it is that they are trying to act out.
If they can figure out what were the given scene keywords, both the team who mimed and the Judges will get points.
Important note: additional points will be awarded to the team who gave the best performance, so give it everything you’ve got!

—description from the publisher

Once every team has had a turn as the Judges, the game ends. The team with the most points wins!

Be ready to laugh out loud!

boardgame.name: Activity Solo & Team
boardgame.description: 2 versions in 1 box of this famous party game: You can either play in teams or each play against all the others.

boardgame.name: Activity Knock Out
Activity Knockout
boardgame.description:
Who is never at a loss of words?
The players role the die to determine the letters which can be used to create words to be found. The challenge lies in the fact that the time one team needs to write down the words can be used by the other team to find the words.

boardgame.name: Bull's Eye
boardgame.description: Fast reaction game! The player who picks up the correct cards first wins.

boardgame.name: Tick Tack Bumm Vibrations
boardgame.description: This is a guessing game for adults. The challenge is that you get a red bomb which can explode at any time.

listing.notes:
Spieleranzahl: 3 bis 8 Spieldauer: 30 Minuten Altersempfehlung: 18+
TICK TACK BUMM Vibrations - Wortspiel Good Vibes! Der tickende Partyspaß jetzt neu nur für Erwachsene!
Endlich ist sie da: die Erwachsenen-Version des seit mehr als 25 Jahren beliebten und (über 8 Mio. verkauft!) erfolgreichen Partyspiels „Tick Tack Bumm" von Piatnik. In „Tick Tack Bumm Vibrations" geht es nicht nur aufgrund der gesuchten Wörter zu schlüpfrigen Kategorien heiß her..Auch die in kräftigem Beerenrot gehaltene Bombe, die bekanntermaßen durch Explosion das Rundenende einläutet, hält eine weitere Überraschung bereit: Sie vibriert ganz zufällig und bringt die Mitspieler damit einmal mehr ins Schwitzen.
Neu und besonders reizvoll ist das zufällige Vibrieren der Bombe während des Spiels. Das Vibrieren wird zum Joker, der blitzschnell für unerwartete Höhepunkte sorgt.
Spielinhalt: 110 Karten mit 220 Kategorien 1 Spielanleitung 1 elektronischer Zeitmesser: die „Bombe“ Zusätzlich werden 3x 1,5 V AAA Batterien benötigt (Batterien nicht enthalten)
Mit Spielregeln in folgenden Sprachen: DE

boardgame.name: Die Stinkies: Rette sich, wer kann!
boardgame.description: Roll the dice as fast as you can and move your tokens accordingly. If you are too slow, the car wash will wet you and you loose.

boardgame.name: Stolpersteig
boardgame.description: Stumbling blocks are all over the place! Every player has 8 tokens to find his way to the castle. But since there are many obstacles, such as stones, water or canyons, it's a real challenge to be the first one in the castle...

listing.notes: minor wear at box, material mint net weight 650 g

boardgame.name: Cars Angelspiel
boardgame.description: Fishing game with the famous cars from the movie! Help Hook to tow away the corresponding cars.

boardgame.name: scene it?
boardgame.description: More than 70 years of soccer history in one quiz game! You watch a film clip randomly chosen and answer some questions about the world championships till 2006.

boardgame.name: Wasser marsch!
boardgame.description: Willy Water, the friendly fire hydrant, is very busy: There is fire threatening the zoo, the cinema, the theme parc and the toys store. All children blow as much as they can to save the city.

boardgame.name: Das grosse Musikquiz
boardgame.description: The quiz game from Abba to ZZ Top, from rock to pop! The game is based on Germany's famous music show and features 528 music questions.

boardgame.name: Galileo Wissens-Quiz
boardgame.description: Quiz game based on the famous TV show Galileo. Test your knowledge and win!

boardgame.name: Bares für Rares: das Spiel zur Trödel-Show!
boardgame.description:
How much is the old vase? How much can I offer in order to persuade the dealers of my rare piece?
The players really feel like in the famous TV show. They have some rare pieces to sell and get support by the experts.

boardgame.name: Hekserij
Hexerei
Sorcellerie
Witchcraft
boardgame.description:
"I am the strongest", shouts the witch and chases away the dog. But she didn't count on the mouse - in order to get away from the mouse she has to take to her heels!
The spinning dice swirl around until all players have decided on a figure. But who is chasing away whom? As a reward for guessing right, you get tidbit cards. A guessing game.
—description from the back of the box

The mechanism is similar to rock-paper-scissors. The children must guess what the others might take and take the better one.
—user summary

boardgame.name: Waldfreunde
boardgame.description: Friends of the forest: On your marks, ready, steady, go! The quirrel, hare, deer and bear are having an exciting competition. They whizz along the bushes and trees as as fast as the wind. But what is happening there? A bush is moving! Which animal doesn't get confused and wins the race?

boardgame.name: Pizza-Pizza
boardgame.description: Pineapple, cheese, tomatoes and many other delicious ingredients are to be put onto the pizza. But one kid has hidden the ingredients carefully: The tomatoes in the bookshelf, the mushroom behind a plant, the salami below the table... The others must rush to find all the items. The first one wins.

boardgame.name: Neverending Motion – The Worm
boardgame.description:
Neverending Motion is an action game physics-based.

The aim of the game is to get the bonus (placed randomly in the scenario) using the magnets positioned on the ground.

Source: The Developer Website.

boardgame.name: Ratz Fatz Weltreise: Mau Mau
boardgame.description:
Perfect combination of the classics "Loco Lingo" and "Mau Mau" - fostering language skills, vocabulary and creativity - for creative storytellers around the world.

Players play cards, some of them with special effects, and use their drawing to tell a story. You need to play cards with the same colour or drawing of the first one, and utilize special effects to change the colour, to play two cards or to loose cards being the first catching the witch. The player that loose all their cards creates an end of the story and wins.

boardgame.name: Ratz Fatz Piraten: Mau Mau.
boardgame.description:
Perfect combination of the classics "Loco Lingo" and "Mau Mau" - fostering language skills, vocabulary and creativity - for creative storytellers within the pirates world.

Players play cards, some of them with special effects, and use their drawing to tell a story. You need to play cards with the same colour or drawing of the first one, and utilize special effects to change the colour, to play two cards or to loose cards being the first catching the witch. The player that loose all their cards creates an end of the story and wins.

boardgame.name: Ratz Fatz Pferde: Mau Mau
boardgame.description:
Perfect combination of the classics "Loco Lingo" and "Mau Mau" - fostering language skills, vocabulary and creativity - for creative storytellers who love horses.

Players play cards, some of them with special effects, and use their drawing to tell a story. You need to play cards with the same colour or drawing of the first one, and utilize special effects to change the colour, to play two cards or to loose cards being the first catching the witch. The player that loose all their cards creates an end of the story and wins.

boardgame.name: Drone Home
Ufodron
boardgame.description: Race to launch your aliens down the ramps and land inside the drone! Watch out—there’s a delay once you make it in, so others can knock you out! If you stay in and your alien escapes when the drone lifts off, you’re one step closer to winning! Get rid of all your aliens first to win!

boardgame.name: Maracaibo: Go7 Gaming Insert
boardgame.description: The Go7 Gaming organizer for Maracaibo provides a total storage solution for your Maracaibo base game. Solution includes three (3) trays for use on the board itself and nine (9) additional trays for use during storage and play. This solution includes twelve (12) removable trays.

boardgame.name: BPM: BULLETS PER MINUTE
Bullets Per Minute
boardgame.description:
BPM is a rhythm-action FPS rogue-like where you must shoot, jump and dodge to the beat of an epic rock soundtrack. Delve into a randomly generated dungeon where one missed note can lead to your death.

Source: The Publisher Website.

boardgame.name: Memo Rondo
boardgame.description:
Funny animal cards are distributed in a circle on eight places. They are shown to all players before they are hidden.
An open card is put on top of each covert card. The arrow card in the middle determines two piles, of which at least one of the two cards below must be guessed.

—user summary

boardgame.name: ELEKTRICO
boardgame.description: A roll&write game in which our task is to power a bizarre machine constructed by a mad scientist. In each of the 8 rounds of the game we have a set of dice which we use to strengthen selected connections. At the end of each round, we choose how the scoring will work, the choice is very important because the same connections will be run several times during the game. The game provides intense intellectual gameplay and a lot of combinations.

boardgame.name: 100 Pulp Era Rumours to Hear
boardgame.description:
Publisher Blurb:

This collection of rumours that characters could hear covers the pulp era of the 1920s and 1930s. The rumours cover a range of types, from lost civilisations and forgotten cities, to experimental technology and weird science, to the occult and the paranormal. Some are given specific locations, but most are not and can easily be dropped in anywhere. The rumours can be used as background flavour, misinformation or sources of potential adventure hooks. Whether or not a specific rumour is true is up to the GameMaster.

This PDF supports Adobe layers and the page backgrounds and images can be disabled to make printing easier.

Here are some sample results:

Explorer Adam Westing has returned from an expedition to the island of Polynesia, along with a strange individual. The individual, who is not much more than 3' tall, appears generally human though with some differences. He has naturally sharp teeth it seems, rather than ones that have been sharpened, and Westing says that the individual is a new subspecies of humanity. Westing's claims have been disputed in the past and it's thought by most experts that the individual is merely someone very short and that this is some sort of con.

Explorers who have recently returned from the African jungle brought with them a young woman who appears to be the now-adult child of a couple who disappeared in the jungle close to two decades ago. The woman seems to have been raised by a remote tribe who have had very little contact with civilisation, and is proving to be a fascinating item to London's set, as she is unlike anyone they have ever encountered before.

Famed author Abraham Sikes has disappeared. Mr Sikes, who is known for his extensive research into the topics he writes about, vanished during some of this research. Though he writes fiction, his books are always based on factual events or legends of such. Sikes's publisher stated that the author was doing research into various curious cults that exist around the world.

Famous explorer Tobias Brunt has apparently disappeared whilst on an expedition deep into the Himalayan wilderness. Brunt was following up on a belief of his that there were strange ruins located within the wilderness, as reported in myth and legend by locals who live in the region. He launched his expedition despite warnings from those locals that the area he was planning to visit was cursed. Brunt and the other members of his expedition have not been seen since.

For years, there have been rumours of some sort of sea monster living in the depths of Lake Michigan, similar to those rumoured to live in other lakes around the world. Explorer, naturalist and adventurer Mark Thomas is determined to catch this monster on film, and has developed a new camera that he claims will both work underwater and can be attached to a small submarine that will be controlled from the surface.

One page is the front cover and one page the front matter.

boardgame.name: 100 Encounters for Fantasy Plains - Supplement for Zweihander RPG
boardgame.description:
Publisher Blurb:

This supplement has 100 different encounters that characters could have when travelling though plains, savannahs and grasslands, those places where there is not much but flat ground, to make the journeys more interesting. These can be used to add detail and colour to a journey through a generally boring region or as a source of adventure hooks. Some are potentially useful, some are potentially hazardous and some are simply odd.

This PDF supports Adobe layers and the page backgrounds and images can be disabled to make printing easier.

Here are some sample results:

A troop of a dozen cavalry rides past in the near distance. Unless the characters act aggressively or look suspicious, the troopers will ignore them. (The cavalry are Dragoons.)

A wagon stands by the side of the road with a broken wheel. The driver is currently repairing the wheel whilst their horse crops the grass. They will appreciate any help, though only have some fresh fruit from the wagon to pay with. (If the characters want to provide aid, they can do so with a (Routine +10%) Tradecraft Test. The reward is a crate of assorted fruits.)

A well-kept house surrounded by a small garden that is enclosed in a fence sits in the middle of the plain. There is no path to the house, nor any nearby settlements. The house, if entered, is in perfect shape, but appears totally unoccupied. It contains food for several days. (The equivalent of 1d10+1 days of rations can be found.)

A wooden fence has been erected in a square, measuring 30' on each side. The fence lacks a gate and the area inside the fence appears identical (an (Easy +20%) Awareness Test) to the area outside it.

A wooden palisade stands on a small berm of earth with a ditch in front of it. This appears to be a small fort, but the gate is smashed and the palisade has been breached in several places. Inside, the buildings are falling to ruin and a few old bones can be found (in 1d5+1 minutes of searching).

Two pages are the front and rear covers and most of one page is ads.

boardgame.name: Hell Architect
boardgame.description:
UNRELEASED GAME – UNAVAILABLE




This game has officially been announced by the publisher or developer, and remains in development. Therefore, some of the game information may change in the future. Until this game is released, please do not submit images for it, nor add new releases. Press Kits are an exception.





Hell Architect is a game about building and managing your own hell. You take on a role of a hell manager and are tasked with developing the underworld in a way that would make Lucifer himself fall off his chair. Create a hell of your dreams - will it have the infamous 9 levels, or will you create your own chaos, the way you see fit? You begin with some basic buildings, like power stations (yup, they need those in hell, too!) and canteens, work your way through shrines and toilets and finish off with some intricate torture contraptions.Source: The Developer Website.

boardgame.name: Back Track
boardgame.description:
Back Track is a first-person shooter that was released for Windows PC in 1998 and for the Game Boy Advance in 2001. It is notable for being the first 3D shooter to be released on the Game Boy Advance.

Domingoaniax, an evil alien, has built up a large invasion force on the dark side of the Moon. The player assumes the role of special agent Jim Track, who has to rescue the 110 kidnapped humans and defeat Domingoaniax's droid army.

BackTrack's multiplayer mode has six deathmatch arenas, each playable as a standard 20-point deathmatch or as a 4-point round-robin. Both modes support up to four players via a link cable.

Source: Wikipedia, "[en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Back_Track Back Track]", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

boardgame.name: Cantaloop: Book 1 – Breaking into Prison
Cantaloop: Buch 1 – Einbruch in den Knast
Cantaloop: Invadindo o Presídio
boardgame.description:
The point-and-click adventure game genre was born in 1976 on the PC. In this type of game, the player assumes the role of a character in an interactive story driven by puzzle solving and exploration. This game is a direct adaption of these mechanics to the cardboard medium that requires no electronics to play. In other words, you are holding a classic point-and-click adventure game in book format. You will talk to characters, combine items to solve puzzles, and explore a unique world to get ahead in the story.

In the first part of the Cantaloop Trilogy, you embody the small-time criminal Oz "Hook" Carpenter who just returned from exile, seeking revenge on the person who made you leave in the first place. But thats easier said than done: You wont stand a chance against the most powerful crook of the city all by yourself. You need a team of people with a unique set of skills if you even want the slightest chance to succeed.

Explore 20 beautifully illustrated locations, talk to characters and solve tricky puzzles to gather your crew in this "Point'n'Click" like game. Search and collect items, figure out where to use them and combine them with each other.

- Open World: You decide where you want to go and when.
- Non-Linear Puzzle Design: There's always at least two puzzles to solve at any given time, so chances that you'll get stuck are minimized.
- 6-10 hours Playtime: Or 18-30 hours for the entire trilogy - a huge game world to immerse yourself in.
- Story-driven: In the prologue (download the Print & Play at lookout-spiele.de) and the 3 parts of the game, the story slowly ramps up to the big heist on Cantaloop Island.
- Humor: Similar to the old point & click adventure games, you'll get a funny response for a lot of the combinations you try.
- Non-Destructive: None of the game material gets destroyed in your playthrough. There is only one sheet of paper that you can easily copy.
- Help System: Should you get stuck, there is a vast help section where you can get up to two hints and the solution to any puzzle.
- No Abstract Puzzles: Every puzzle fits into the world and story of Cantaloop.
- Dialogues: Most of Cantaloop's story is told in speech bubbles, encouraging player groups to roleplay the scenes together.
- Secrets: There MAY be a few easter eggs and unlockables sprinkled throughout Cantaloop, but I'm sure that's just hearsay.

--description from publisher

boardgame.name: Taxi Simulator
boardgame.description:
Become a taxi driver and experience for yourself the everyday life in such interesting profession. One might think that working behind a taxi wheel is a dull and nondescript task. But you couldn’t be more wrong! In Taxi Simulator you will play as a shady rap driver and drive through the wildly urban areas. Don’t worry too much about your reputation though, as it can be improved later on. You start on the lowest level in the city’s hierarchy. you are just an average cabby. Your task will be obviously to transport people.

Source: The Developer Website.

boardgame.name: Envoys to the Mount
boardgame.description:
From the back cover:

IN THE DEPTHS OF THE SHADOW BARRENS, EVIL AWAKENS

The ancient connections between the nomadic Roamer folk of Aldis and the eldritch folk known as the vata has [sic] long been suspected, but never confirmed. When an emissary from the far-off vata stronghold known as Mount Oritaun comes to Aldis seeking a familiar face and a favor from its Queen, a small band of envoys from the Sovereign’s Finest are assigned to lend their aid against the sinister power of the Shadow Barrens.

Envoys to the Mount provides four adventure chapters spanning five years and all four tiers of Blue Rose play. Together they form an epic campaign that sees the heroes not only facing off against the forces of Shadow, but also unlocking some of the ancient secrets of the world of Aldea. Envoys to the Mount also provides:


A complete gazetteer for the Shadow Barrens, the vile city of Austium, and long-lost Mount Oritaun.
A extensive guide to the organization and people of the Sovereign’s Finest, guardians of Aldis.
A host of creatures and characters for use within or outside of this storyline.


This epic adventure path and sourcebook requires the use of the Blue Rose: The AGE RPG of Romantic Fantasy rulebook.

boardgame.name: Autopsy Simulator
boardgame.description:
Autopsy Simulator is a simulator game with horror elements which transforms into mystery. The player takes the role of pathologist named Jack. During the autopsy of mysterious woman, Jack finds inside her the engagement ring of his long lost wife Kate. When the action is in progress other elements of the mystery are found. In order to reveal the truth, Jack has to fight a battle with the sinister forces and his own thoughts.

Source: The Developer Website.

boardgame.name: Vermot: le grand tournoi
boardgame.description:
Vermot: le grand tournoi for the fan of the Vermot and passionate about French popular culture.

The Vermot is now available in the form of a board game.

Roll the dice and test your knowledge of the Vermot universe in a course strewn with pitfalls.
320 cards containing more than 600 questions divided into 6 sections: History, Sport, Humor, Leisure, Science and health, Society.

Game play:
roll the dice and advance your pawn on a 30-day calendar board dotted with bonus spaces. Whoever fills their calendar first wins.

boardgame.name: Urban Explorer
boardgame.description:
Urban Explorer is a first person perspective exploration game with parkour mechanics and horror elements.
Explore abandoned buildings, top secret facilities and catacombs, as well as places still in use, such as engine rooms, elevator shafts and abandoned building floors. You’ve got to stay on your toes and consider many dangers – collapsing floors and ceilings, chemicals and other hazardous substances, some not-so-welcoming inhabitants, security or motion detection equipment.

Source: The Developer Website.

boardgame.name: Split
boardgame.description:
Split is a FPP puzzle game with unique mechanic, when you can create your own copies and manipulate time. It takes place in in the year 2072, when the global network has become so advanced that every aspect of the society was controled by an entity called the Shield System.

Source: The Developer Website.

boardgame.name: MonsDRAWsity: Cute Creatures
boardgame.description:
More monsters have been spotted! The cute expansion is the first in our line of thematic expansions for MonsDRAWsity that will add more cards to keep the game fresh!

- Expansion for MonsDRAWsity with thematic new monsters
- Gives you more games, new cards, and an extra player board to expand it to 9 players!
- Adds cute monsters that are simpler to describe to make the game even more accessible for kids!

boardgame.name: Our Ladies of Safe Harbor
boardgame.description:
Developer's description:

Storm clouds gather as the bells of Brindlewood Bay’s historic Little Chapel of Safe Harbor ring. For decades, boats would shuttle tourists to the chapel’s home, a tiny island two miles off shore. Wealthier families would book the chapel — and its magnificent gardens — for their weddings and galas.

The chapel has fallen into disrepair in recent years, so the local Historic Preservation Commission has organized a fundraiser to support the chapel’s restoration.

Aboard a cabin cruiser grumbling through choppy waters, the Murder Mavens travel to the chapel to help Brother Benjamin and Sister Jeffreys prepare for the afternoon’s auction and rummage sale.


* *


Get cozy and enjoy a brand new, rain-soaked mystery for Brindlewood Bay. Meet new residents of the bay, explore new locations, and experience horrifying new glimpses into the void

boardgame.name: MAST BUY
boardgame.description:
MAST BUY is an auction game where the players are athletes in a yacht race and must purchase the masts they will use.

The "masts" in the game consist of a set of small wooden dowels between 120mm and 160mm in 5 mm increments, with multiple of each size. Each player starts the game with 50 money, marked on a board, a random mast, and a blue stone.

On a turn, a player chooses a mast, blindly, from the game box to put up for auction. The auction proceeds around the table with each player making a pass or bidding and the last player to place a bid winning the mast.

The game ends when a player has won a certain number of masts, four of the same size, or is out of money.

If a player has collected four of the same size, they immediately win. Otherwise, players earn points for the number of masts they have in sequential size order (5 mm apart), with duplicates of a size adding no additional points. Players also earn points for money that they did not spend. The player with the most points wins.

boardgame.name: Abstammungen und Herkünfte
Lost Omens: Ancestry Guide
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Remember who you are! The Age of Lost Omens is filled with people of all types, including more than just those of common ancestries. Lost Omens Ancestry Guide places the spotlight on the uncommon and rare ancestries of the Inner Sea (like geniekin, androids, kitsune, sprites, and more!), providing information on their cultures and place in the world. The book also expands on the rules options for these ancestries and versatile heritages. Finally, Lost Omens Ancestry Guide also features new ancestries and versatile heritages including some that are brand new, as well as old favorites from throughout Golarion!

boardgame.name: Maximum Apocalypse: Redhead
boardgame.description:
Promotional Redhead character card deck and miniature based on The Few & Cursed graphic novel for use in Maximum Apocalypse.

Included as part of The Few and Cursed: Deluxe Expansion.
boardgame.boardgamecompilation: The Few and Cursed: Deluxe Expansion

boardgame.name: Quiz For Friends
boardgame.description:
Play with your friends and family.
Start with the question "who ...?" And ask the questions written on the cards. Put your friends and family into precarious situations and find out what they really think about you!

There are 2 play options:
1- Everyone plays individually, each player writes down the name of the player they think matches the most the description. If your name has the most votes, you get the card.

2 - Divide the group into teams of 2 to 4 players. All members of one team receive 1 answer card and a marker. A player from the other team draws a card and reads it aloud. The players in the group with the answer cards write down the name of the player that fits the most. They are NOT allowed to communicate. At the end of the hourglass, the players turn their cards around. If they all wrote the same name, they win the card. The group with most cards at the end wins.

boardgame.name: ALPAKALAND
boardgame.description: Our task in the game is to design a theme park with alpacas. We have to build buildings, homesteads, roads. Then place different species of alpacas so that the park is as attractive to visitors as possible. In each round we receive random resources from the dice which we have to use properly.

boardgame.name: Hero Mail
boardgame.description:
Hero Mail is a cooperative or solo playable push your luck and resource management game in which you play local superheroes who must protect their city from a villain with sinister plans. The whole game fits on a postcard and there are different postcards for different cities with unique mechanics.

The game runs in 2 phases. In the first phase the heroes try to stop the villain's plans before he becomes too strong. The villain first collects threat markers based on the behaviour of the heroes in the last round and the current scenario. These are distributed to the different plans. Then the Heroes can recharge and use their abilities by forming 2 pairs from 4 dice rolled and taking an action marker with the corresponding number. If the number is no longer available, it cannot be taken. And if no available or already taken number is rolled and the dice cannot be manipulated with the hero's abilities, the hero loses all markers collected in this round. Heroes can decide to end their turn at any time, in which case they may use their markers to prevent the villain's plans, reduce damage or recharge their abilities. Once all heroes have finished their turn, the villain's unresolved plans are handled and his power increases according to the heroes' behaviour.
When all plans have been foiled or the villain has become too strong, it comes to the grand finale, in which the heroes must defeat the villain. The heroes must complete tasks based on the action markers they have placed during the course of the game.

This game was designed during the second corona wave and has several free to download scenarios, to bring some boardgames to everybody during the social distance time. You can also send the postcard with game to your game playing friends and Relatives. You can also support your local game store with this game, as there are several special scenario postcards, which are exclusive available in local game stores.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Mage Forge
boardgame.description: In the game we run a magic forge whose goal is to create magical objects. Using a common resource of dice, each player tries to create and improve items so that they finally have the most power. The game requires long-term planning and sensible resource management.In each round, players have 6 dice at their disposal to give magical properties to the objects: they increase their power, unlock the colors of magic, upgrade, and finally create the magical dust necessary to complete the project. After 7 turns, all players compare the collections of created items. The winner is the player whose items are the most powerful

boardgame.name: Last Species
boardgame.description:
A triangle board contains 121 tiles, you control 3 rescuers of the WWF association. You will have to move, explore the jungle and the oceans in order to find the 7 last endangered species before your opponent. You will have to use cleverly all objects you pick up when you move upon tiles to put all chances to your side.

—user summary

boardgame.name: OUTCLASSED: The NPC Statblock Compendium
boardgame.description:
"This 200+ page book was written to alleviate the agony of creating a completely new character for enemies with class levels simply because there aren't many NPC statblocks available in the officially published books. Before now, if you wanted your party to fight a righteous paladin, your options were basically a knight (MM) or a blackguard (VGM). Now you have thirteen new options! For example. There are dozens of barbarians, bards, clerics, druids, fighters, monks, paladins, rangers, rogues, sorcerers, warlocks, wizards, and even some non-traditional classes like artificer, blood hunter, and rouge, not to mention dozens of smaller disconnected statblocks for NPCs that fit a specific purpose outside of a class identity.

Included in this book:

180 NPC statblocks
12 flavourful write-ups on how to incorporate the DnD classes as factions into your game
Guides for quickly applying race and class to a statblock
Many indices sorted by class, CR, thematic similarity, and sourcebook
Clarifications and examples of the thought process behind building NPCs
Bonus material and variant rules as easter eggs peppered throughout
Flavourful blurbs of action for each statblock
Pure white and black aesthetic. No distracting images or fancy effects. Just what you need, where you need it."

(Author Summary)

boardgame.name: Escape Room: The Game – Challenge
boardgame.description:
You've been captured by a mad genius. He'll let you go only if you prove yourself worthy! Solve as many puzzles as you can in ten minutes and hope you'll survive! Play by yourself or in a team and deal with the pressure of solving riddles and puzzles while time is ticking away...

Escape Room: The Game – Challenge consists of a deck of 24 cards and decoder card. Each card has double-sided riddles and an answer obfuscated behind a red/blue filter. You can play solo and try to see how many you can get in ten minutes, and that's your score.

You can play cooperatively in teams and race the other team drawing from the common deck. There's a decoder card to check your answer.
boardgame.boardgamefamily: Series: Escape Room – The Game (Identity Games International B.V.)

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

boardgame.name: Jo ed il suo Scudo
Prehistories: Shield
boardgame.description:
Prehistories: Shield is a set of five hunter cards — one for each player — with a shield symbol on the card. Shuffle this card into your deck at the start of the game, and play it with other cards when placing a bid during a round. When you play it, this card ensures that you will not be injured during the hunt phase.

This mini-expansion, which will be distributed in board game stores, is a tribute to Benoit Turpin's uncle Jo, who passed away during the graphic development of the game.

boardgame.name: Survivor Challenge
boardgame.description:
Survivor Challenge is a card game in which you can playfully get fit! Challenge yourself and others with 70 playing cards for a varied training program and intensive group fun. If you fail a challenge, you're out of the game — and if everyone else has dropped out, then you win.

•••

Survivor Challenge ist das erste Fitnessspiel, mit du spielerisch fit wirst! Fordere dich und andere heraus: mit 70 Spielkarten, abwechslungsreichem Trainingsprogramm und intensivem Gruppenspaß. Überall und jederzeit. Ganz ohne Geräte. Mit nur einem Ziel: Am längsten durchzuhalten und der Survivor zu werden!

boardgame.name: Iron Helm: Adventure Pack #5 – Throne of Embers
boardgame.description:
Throne of Embers is the 5th Adventure Pack for Iron Helm that adds all new Loot, Skills, Trappings, Plots, a new Boss to fight, and a new Character to play as. You will need to own the base game of Iron Helm to play this expansion.

Throne of Embers is a level two Adventure Pack meaning it is to be incorporated with the base game as your second adventure if you survive the base game.

boardgame.name: Lands of Theia
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

In the Lands of Theia, adventure never waits.

Welcome to the first campaign setting that details the shattered worlds for Pathfinder 1st Edition. Magical sky races, volcanic jungles, steam-powered metropolises, and continent-spanning cave networks are only some of the wonders that await adventurers in this fantasy realm.

With a wealth of options at their disposal, players can experience exciting new ways to build memorable characters. Gamemasters will enjoy a first look at the world of Theia and its many varied people, while spotlights and story hooks act as windows through which we introduce plots to help jumpstart a game or expanded upon in future adventure paths.

boardgame.name: OK RPG
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

OK RPG is a minimal RPG engine with a few special design goals: simplicity, completeness, and player investment. It strives to be:


Simple to read, understand, and master. OK RPG is a two-page pamphlet written with easy, natural language.The game assumes no experience with RPGs, and the core mechanic is ludicrously simple.
A rules system that is completely closed, and explains play from start to finish. OK RPG never needs interpretations or "house rules", because the rules are designed to handle any situation.
Inclusive and agency-forward. The rules make sure all the players have narrative agency and uses mechanical elements to tie players to the story.
Streamlined. The basic mechanic uses only 3 normal dice and the game consists of just a few core rules. OK RPG is designed to get the rules out of the way of the narrative fun.

boardgame.name: Triumphus
boardgame.description:
The Emperor is holding trials for the new party planner needed for our nation's greatest celebration - The Triumphus! Dress to impress, or end up like the last poor soul. This is the most important party of your life!

In Triumphus, you will need to use your best supplies, including wine, decorations, food, entertainment, and offerings, to gain The Emperor's rewards, which you can sell to obtain even more supplies, or hoard to gain his respect.

On your turn, you will attempt to match the supplies from the cards in your hand with the requirements on a single reward card in the community market of five cards. If you can match all of the icons on a reward, discard the supplies and take the reward, which will be valued between 4-7 points; however, the only way to get more of the necessary supplies is to sell a reward by flipping it face down and drawing as many supply cards as the card's point value. This will reduce the points for the card from face-value to only 1, so make sure you only sell rewards when you need to. And make sure you don't have more than 10 supplies at the end of your turn or you'll need to discard!

Keep up this simple loop, deciding at every turn whether you'll need an extra supply or an extra point to win. The game continues until the last reward has been collected. Count your points to see who gets the job and the favor of the high court! Every reward card you haven't sold is face-value, plus 1 additional point for each one you have sold.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Big 4 Football
boardgame.description:
Board and strategy game in the colors of your favorite team (out of 4) which takes you to the heart of football league 1, with the four flagship clubs of the French football championship.

Select your players, dribble, tackle, score goals with your favorite team.

The cards of the 22 players and the coaches of the four teams (PSG, OM, ASSE, LOSC) are included in each game box.

boardgame.name: Over Arms
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Over Arms is a rules-light tabletop pen-and-paper role-playing game designed to replicate media like JoJo’s Bizarre Adventure, Persona, FATE ,Shaman King and more. Over Arms is set in a world where select people are able to develop an "Anima", a powerful psychic manifestation of their own psyche and will. These "Anima" are able to assist their "User" in a myriad of ways in and out of combat based on the strengths of their individually unique abilities. In Over Arms players can expect to weave stories of mystery and intrigue as they discover this new world around them and within.

boardgame.name: Wings of Glory: Tripods & Triplanes – WW2 Counter Set
boardgame.description:
Play Tripods & Triplanes using WW2 Wings of Glory airplanes. Includes a complete set of counters compatible with normal WW2 rules. This set requires Wings of Glory WWII base game or rules set and WWII aircraft (sold separately).

—description from the publisher
boardgame.boardgameaccessory: Wings of Glory: WW2 Battle of Britain Starter Set
Wings of Glory: WW2 Rules and Accessories Pack
Wings of Glory: WW2 Starter Set

boardgame.name: Dima's Ascent
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Dima's Ascent takes its name from Dima Mahkas, the adventurer and explorer who first mapped the region years ago, and the densely forested, rising terrain that leads to the mountainous slopes to the south and east. Traveling through the area is challenging. Several trails lead into the forest, but they all fade to nothing beneath the thick canopy. Foresters, hunters, and trade guilds have attempted to blaze trails through the woods, but guides get lost, blazes disappear, and markers move or vanish. There are two permanent campsites in Dima's Ascent, Mahkas Hill Camp and Two Peaks Camp, but getting to them is difficult. A more substantial campsite on the west edge of the forest, Shade, serves as a jumping-off point for travelers. Those heading east who are lucky enough to stumble upon Lake Greenwood can usually reach the mountains beyond the Ascent by following the lake's shore. Some visitors try to find the Pierced Stone, a massive boulder with a 10-foot wide natural hole through its center. Others seek out the Faelight Grotto, a small natural cave filled with magical glowing lights.

boardgame.name: Plain of Mire
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

From a distance, the Plain of Mire is a green and pleasant place, but looks are deceiving. The greenery is a mix of stiff, head-high grass and reeds that slice exposed flesh and thick algae mats that hide treacherous murky pools. Fog fills the air morning and evening, so it's easy to get turned around when all you see is grass. The sole landmarks are the continually shifting Circa River and a few small hills. Two of these mounds, Wolf Rock and Finger Hill, are marked by ruins. The third hill, Shadow Ridge, is overgrown with twisted, half-dead trees. Redwater Spring burbles up from the ground and adds its weirdly colored waters to the surrounding pools, and the Suck pulls those who attempt to plumb its depths to their deaths.

boardgame.name: Witch's Shrine
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

A gigantic skull sits central on a platform of ancient stone and moss, four paths span the chasms that surround this skull, one path however has broken over the ages and now a gap lies between. The dark and dreary forest blocks the light from above and produces a sickly smell of death.

Within the ancient skull lies three small altars, each with the skull of an animal of the woods. Around them candles flicker gently providing ambient light and in front of the altars lies a small hole used for sacrifices.

boardgame.name: Skull Island's Hoard
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

A gigantic skull sits central on a platform of ancient stone and moss, four paths span the water filled chasms that surround this skull one path however has broken over the ages and now a gap lies between. The tropical palms also give much needed shade and leave a sweet scent in the air.

Within the ancient skull lies three chests, and a hoard of gold coins and artifacts long lost to man.

boardgame.name: Stairway to Hell
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

A gigantic skull sits central on a platform of ancient stone, four paths span the lava filled chasms that surround this skull one path however has broken over the ages and now a gap lies between. The desolate landscape spans out to the horizon and noxious gases rise up from the roiling magma below.

Within the ancient skull lies a spiral staircase that descents deeper and deeper into the earth.

boardgame.name: Fountain of Youth
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

A gigantic skull sits central on a platform of ancient stone and moss, four paths span the chasms that surround this skull one path however has broken over the ages and now a gap lies between. The dark and dreary forest blocks the light from above and produces a sickly smell of death.

Within the ancient skull lies a rounded well, a dark reddish liquid deathly still within. On the edge of the well lie bones of all sorts, but they mostly seem to be human.

boardgame.name: Basilisk's Gully Mine
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Cold bellows up from the yawning abyss that this mine was built on. Beyond the lush forest a broken bridge crosses the deep pit, wooden frameworks have fallen away and the small shacks that surround this pit are in complete disarray.

Makeshift wooden walkways crisscross the gap and connect the old collapsed tunnels to the central platform where an old crane sits silent and unused. Wooden crates and barrels still containing implements or mining materials gathered here still remain and may yet be of use.

Adventure Seed

An invasive species of animated shoe has shown up in this region and begun causing trouble. They harass villagers and travelers alike, nipping at their heels for subjugating others of their—non-animated—kind. It has grown so bad that the villagers have begun to stop wearing shoes, for fear of the little menaces.

Fed up with walking everywhere barefoot, the villagers have employed you to seek out the breeding grounds, and vanquish them. Everyone knows the shoes are shy, and will only multiply in dark, secluded places.

You track the shoes to an abandoned mine, where an old wizard lives in a shack built into its wall. There is a beautiful shoe—clearly the master of all shoes—on his head. He is dressed in filthy rags, with a long white beard and unkempt hair. Clearly, he’s been out here a while…

He runs at you with glassy eyes, yelling at you in gibberish and throwing cantrips as a warning.

What’s happening? The wizard who created the sentient shoes as an experiment found events spiraling out of hand quickly as the shoes began to multiply. Then came the master shoe, who jumped onto his head and has been mind-controlling him since.

If your players make a successful role for insight, they will realize he isn’t gibbering mindlessly, but rather, speaking the language of the shoes.

If you can separate him from the master shoe, perhaps he will regain his wits?

boardgame.name: The Furnace
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Heat bellows up the shattered tunnels from the heart of the furnace. Beyond the pillared passage the broken bridge crosses a molten circle, wooden frameworks have fallen away and the small shacks that surround this pit are in complete disarray.

Makeshift wooden walkways crisscross the gap and connect the tunnels to the central platform where an old crane sits silent and unused. Wooden crates and barrels still containing implements or mining materials gathered here still remain and may yet be of use.

Map Theme: Lakeside Ruins

Each Free Map Friday ZIP contains five 5100x3300 pixel (600 dpi) high-resolution versions of a single dungeon map. Those versions include:

1. Virtual Tabletop (VTT) Map
2. Player Map (With Grids)
3. Player Map (Without Grids)
4. GM Map
